results.description:
We are about business owners helping each other. 

Learn from other business owners and help increase the chances of success. Smaller business owners need all the help they can get. The SBA Government agency suggests more than 50% of new US companies fail in the first 5 years and a similar amount thereafter. The odds are stacked against new businesses and entrepreneurs. Understand and learn from owners who have experienced similar issues through business cycles from startup struggles to the relative utopia of predictable success. Gain exposure to other business owners in a collaborative, open and caring framework. Learning and sharing with other community business owners is an invaluable opportunity. This meet-up group provides a medium for entrepreneurs and business owners to reach one another, network, mentor, gain opportunities and forge relationships.

If you are thinking of starting a business, or maybe already operating and or growing a company you can benefit from other business owners knowledge and experience. Talent alone is often not necessarily enough to make a business work in the long run. Learn and share with others to help minimize poor decisions and optimize the opportunity for success. How did other business owners get the right funding, which digital marketing companies have burnt them, what CPAs or Attorneys are recommended, how do they recruit quality staff, why an LLC not a C corp. The list of questions is endless and diverse, many common to all businesses and some more specific and segmented by industry. The opportunity to accelerate your business through the community of other business owners knowledge is extremely powerful. We invite you to join to a network to help benefit you and other business owners in our communities.
results.name: Fairfield/Westchester improve business predictable success

Welcome everybody! I didn't really see any kind of group like this on Meetup, so I thought it'd be cool to have a slightly different video game based group on here!

This is meant to be a relaxing, casual get-together where you can meet new people, share a common interest with new friends, and maybe even learn some new things about your favorite game(s)! We encourage that everyone try and play the games we'll be talking about for yourselves but it's okay if you can't either. You might learn about their experiences in ways that you never would have gotten playing it yourself anyway. And we'll be trying to have meetups that can revolve around everyone playing something at the same time as well to spread events around the month. 

I do ask that everyone signing up for the group have a clear picture of themselves on their profile so that we can recognize members for each meetup. I'll be taking suggestions from the sign-up questions on what our games for each month are going to be, and we'll go from there. Other than that, all we ask is that you're ready to have a good time and talk about games with new friends! Hope to see you at a meetup!

results.description:
•First and foremost, this is kind of an experiment for me - I was introduced to Meetup in 2015 and attended a whole bunch of Meetups, ranging from '80s dance parties to language events to ski outings, etc. I was trying to meet new and interesting people with an actual interest in making long term friends, but that didn't really happen. So, one of my resolutions for 2016 was to create this group and interact with sane, normal people looking to make genuine friendships.

I'm hoping there are some normal folks out there looking to make new friends, either because their old ones moved away, or their friends all got married and became boring, or through some crazy mishmash of circumstances find themselves without some solid people to hang with. 


This group is for those in their 20s/30s and fit the criteria below: 

• You are sane - this is rule #1; if you're a creep or a narcissistic psychopath, this isn't the Meetup for you, sorry.

• You're actually interested in building real, genuine friendships, and not here to meet some new people you hang out with for a month and then suddenly stop. (Of course, if you just don't click with them that's a different matter altogether).

• You are not a bigot - All are welcome as long as you're willing to try talking to new people and can respect others' viewpoints.

• You are single - as in, you're not engaged or married. I find married people are either busy doing nothing or doing their own thing that they forget about their friends (yes, this has happened to me). Sorry if you're married - hey, at least you've got your significant other to hang out with, right?

• You are not using this Meetup as some kind of dating venue - such activity won't be allowed. Besides, trying to sleep with your friends usually ends horribly. Many songs have been written about it - trust me on this one.
results.name: Sane People Who Want To Make Real, Genuine Friends

Girlfriends Pray (GP) Local is everywhere, for every woman, in every season of her life! Once a month our Local Ambassadors host a Saturday morning meet-up in cities all around the world to discuss prayer, and connect with women in their local communities for fellowship, food, and fun on the strength of our faith.

It is the mission of Girlfriends Pray Ministries to get more women closer to God through prayer; and our vision is to get 1 million women around the world united in prayer. Although we are a non-traditional unconventional ministry with 80% of our service to women delivered virtually, in 2015 we expanded our service to women nationally and internationally off-line with our LIVE Breakfast Book Club (BBC) prayer groups. We encourage you to also partner with us as day after day we connect with women all around the global and come face-to-face with real life issues, challenges and the needs of women. So many women depend on Girlfriends Pray Ministries as a life line to God. Every day we see lives changed, lives impacted and souls led back to Jesus Christ through our local meet-ups and our prayer line, (712) 775-7031 access code 943334#. Here's a testimony from one of our girlfriends, Courtney -- “For those of you just joining Girlfriends Pray, if it had not been for God and this prayer line on my side …. Where would I be … in the grave by my own hand!”

We thank you in advance for joining us and your financial gift as an offering for the ongoing support of Girlfriends Pray Ministries. To become a partner please CLICK HERE.

We look forward to meeting you face-to-face at our next monthly meet-up.

Girlfriends Pray Local Ambassador Leadership Team
Praying Without Ceasing.... 1 Thessalonians 5:17
Girlfriends Pray Ministries
Prayer Line: (712) 775-7031 access code 943334#
Email: Local@GirlfriendsPray.org
Website: www.GirlfriendsPray.org
@GirlfriendsPray

results.description:
Networking has become the cornerstone of all businesses and careers. Yet, the networking event has become a commodity. Many events around town focus on attracting volumes of attendees, exchanging business cards and potentially meeting someone new. Sure, it's great if your goals are aligned to any one or more of these results. However, you're probably asking yourself these two questions when you leave the event:

How many true connections did I make?
Was the event worth my time?

Chances are....you probably didn't get what you paid for (in time and money).

Our goal for NYC Startup Connectors is to create opportunities for entrepreneurs and other business professionals to connect in a more meaningful way. What do we mean by meaningful? Bringing people together for a defined purpose that aims to help you. Our events and activities focus on the art of connecting, rather than networking. (Quality over quantity). After all, establishing connections and building relationships shouldn't be about sales pitches or propositions, rather, what did you actually learn from the other person and how can you help them as well.

We will offer a variety of events throughout the year that primarily focus on the problems startups and entrepreneurs face. These experiences will involve local activities and tours that bring people together in different ways along with a few weekend escape trips that will get our connect our community outside the city.
results.name: NYC Startup Connectors

results.description:
First, this is a group dedicated to making members' short films happen. Members have different experience, interests, and skill sets, and want to work on projects. If you have a script but not very much money, I want this group to be a resource of people you can draw on to do everything from producing to holding the boom mike.

Second, this group is a social group. Let's talk about issues facing us as short filmmakers, let's talk about movies we liked and why. I think we can even review scripts, if people are inclined, and give notes, although that's not the primary purpose of this group.

Email your scripts to 10163pc@gmail.com, my email, and I'll distribute them to members. If people are drawn to your work, they'll help you out.

results.description: In Living Color is a once a month after work party from 6pm to 11pm where young professionals, creatives and nightlife goers meet when in search of a bit more culture to add to their nightlife experience. Centered around the idea of “live art” through the use of live painting and a hip-hop DJ-violinist duo who follow behind Brooklyn celebrity DJ Trauma, the room is a buzz between hipsters, artists, taste makers and everyone in between. With great food and a great ambiance, don’t be surprised if you run into your next co-worker here as it’s great for networking.
results.name: "In Living Color" Live Art Party in Brooklyn

results.description:
The Ridgewood Singers is an SATB mixed voice community chorus of about 50 singers in Ridgewood, NJ. These happy singers welcome newcomers and make you feel right at home. Some of them perform with other area choruses too.

Rehearsals are well-paced and stimulating. There are two rehearsal seasons: September to December, and January to May, with two concerts per year --- in May & December. Rehearsals are 7:30 to 9:30 p.m. on Monday evenings in a wonderfully accommodating rehearsal space in West Side Presbyterian Church at 6 South Monroe Street, Ridgewood. 

Membership dues are $55 per season. SATB scores are loaned to singers when dues are paid.

The group performs a wide variety of music and some artistically and musically challenging pieces too (great way to grow!). Professional music director and professional accompanist (see bios under PAGES). Singers are warmly invited to sample a rehearsal to see how they like us (no obligation). 

We look forward to meeting you and sharing the joy of singing with you! 

For information, please send a message to Linda D. and we can exchange info and chat if you like. 

PAGES: Click on the PAGES tab on top of the home page, to find our professionals' bios, concert attire, and more information about TRS. Thank you.

www.theridgewoodsingers.com
results.name: The Ridgewood Singers

results.description: Join the largest figure drawing group in Westchester! Drink-&-Draw is an event created by the New Rochelle Arts Collective, it's an uninstructed figure drawing session with a social twist. Our monthly sessions are 3hrs long in the evenings. Our models pose nude and at times in costume with props for 1min - 20mins poses. Our attendees range from local creatives seeking to brush up on their craft, to newcomers curious about this creative tradition. We provide the model and music, and you guys provide the good vibes. Our events are BYOB and BYOAS event (Bring Ya Own Art Supplies, NO acrylics or oil paints please) $15 at the door 18+ to enter; 21+ to drink
results.name: Westchester Drink & Draw

results.description: The TV and media industries are going through the biggest transformation since the 1980s. Video is on the rise both from a user consumption perspective and for content publishers. 64% of the global mobile traffic is done for video. It will be 80% by 2019. Consumers of all ages are already "cutting the chord" and/or adding additional streaming services to meet their dynamic viewing habits (ie. Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Video, HBONow, etc.). The Over-The-Top (OTT) and video on demand (VOD) arenas are changing by the day, with many players moving into the space. New York is home to the leading media, TV, and content providers on the planet. This is a group for anyone interested in digital media, video, OTT/VOD, streaming services, etc. Feel free to network, talk strategy, and discuss trends. Wax your boards, the wave is coming ...

results.description:
Want to make this the year when you finally start taking as good care of yourself, as you have everyone else in your life? Want to have more energy, improved health, and develop positive stress management skills, but the idea of joining a gym or going on yet another "doomed to failure" diet, are big turnoffs? Then this is the Meetup for you!!
Want to develop the physical, and emotional tools necessary to live functionally, and independently as you navigate the aging process? Then this is the Meetup for you!!
Through the combination of evidenced-based health and fitness exercises and information*, presented by a Certified Health Coach and Senior Fitness Specialist who will also facilitate group interaction and support, you can begin to make realistic and sustainable changes to your physical and psychological health!! * - As with any physical fitness activity, medical clearance is strongly recommended. As well as, informing the Health Coach of any pre-existing health concerns.
results.name: Senior "Fitness For Life" Meetup

results.description: This group is for anyone associated with the radio/podcasting "biz" to meet once a month and chat about the stuff going on in this crazy, fast-growing industry. It's also for sharing, kvetching, dreaming, learning,  inquiring and, of course, drinking. results.description: This is a group for New Yorkers who are looking for a more empowered, aware, and purposeful approach to life. Where your mind, heart, and body are all aligned for optimal performance and presence. Where we can gather together to share our passions with others. We don't strive for work/life balance as much as work/life integration because we believe work should be much more than just a paycheck. Most of us have tried living compartmentalized lives. You have your job, you have your friends, you have your personal beliefs, and for the most part you keep them separate because it's easier to manage that way. But eventually it gets tiring to try and keep all the plates spinning and the returns are diminishing. If you're looking for some more inspiration and purpose, come join us! We don't claim to have solutions. We believe, in the words of Joseph Campbell, that we're not really seeking the meaning of life, what we’re really seeking is "an experience of being alive." This group is for anyone who wants to be a part of exploring such experiences through finding fun, casual events throughout the city that can expand our consciousness and understanding of our own minds, emotions, and bodies.
results.name: NYC Integrate Your Life

results.description: It takes a village to raise a family! I don't have any family around so I want to find other families to enjoy the ride with. As a mother of 3 young children, I am never alone, but am somehow very lonely. Am I the only one? Let's form our own "village"!

results.description:
Members are interested in emergency communications using amateur (Ham) radio and are (or aspire to be) licensed by the FCC as Ham radio operators. This Meetup was formed to facilitate getting or upgrading a Ham radio license.

We also have a group of about 30 active Hams called ARCsquared. ARCsquared  stands for American Red Cross Amateur Radio Club. We are located at the Northern New Jersey headquarters of the New Jersey Region of the American Red Cross, and our "Base station", call sign NJ2RC, is located in the Disaster Operations Center ("DOC"). It is a project that was started in 2005 by ARC volunteers to improve the ARC's ability to communicate during disaster and emergency operations. It is not a corporation or other legal entity.  It is a group of hams interested in assisting The American Red Cross.  Hams are urged to become official Red Cross volunteers. 

For more information, the website is www.arcsquared.org.
results.name: NJ Ham Radio Group

results.description:
For over 15 years, the NYC .NET Developers Group has been the definitive community for .NET Developers in the New York City Metropolitan area. Each month, we bring you top speakers, free product giveaways, and great community networking, all for free. We meet the 3rd Thursday of each month at the NY Microsoft Offices at 11 Times Square (West 41st Street and 8th Avenue), 6th Floor.

Our group is run by well known experts in Microsoft technologies, including Microsoft MVPs and the Microsoft Regional Director for New York and New Jersey. Our own enthusiasm for the .NET platform and our close relationship with Redmond, Microsoft NY/NJ and the third-party .NET community ensure great speakers and great information.

The NYC .NET Developers Group now has a new home on Meetup, formerly hosted at http://www.nycdotnetdev.com.
results.name: NYC .NET Developers

results.description: Private group with a guide and a cook hike to Lost City in Colombia. Lost City is older them Machu Picchu! 30 miles in 4 days hiking through out the jungle is an unforgettable experience enjoying the stunning views and meeting local tribes. Who else is in? I am setting up a group of around 6-8 people to go to Colombia by probably end of February - beginning of March. Dates are still being worked out. Let's meet for a drink, try it out at a local 10-12 mile hike, set up a date and have a blast in Colombia. I will take care of logistics. The trek on its own is ca $400-450, which includes food, snacks and accommodations. You will have to fly to Santa Marta, Colombia. Let's have an adventure! Here is a link to a YouTube video just to get an idea where you are going https://youtu.be/1HyVWo8vGWA.
results.name: Lost City in Colombia, 4 day trek

Things we'll be doing: Beer tastings, beer dinners, tasting competitions, larger social events for charity, holiday parties, seasonal events, and more! results.description:
The first thing a doctor does is check your vitals before they can diagnose the problem. The Vitals Workshop operates on the same principal but applied to your business.  First, we establish where your brand works and doesn't work.  Then we provide you a prescription through a series of actionable guides and steps you can take to create a dominant social brand.

topics.name: Tabletop Role Playing and Board Games

results.description:
This is a group for CCGs, RPGs, and Wargaming in Manhattan. This group meets every week and is administrated by a serious RPG and Wargaming expert.

Beginners are encouraged to join.  You can get free CCG, RPG, and Wargaming tutoring at any of our events.

Our events are located in Midtown Manhattan, Lower Manhattan, and in Queens.


_______________________________________________________________________________________________

A MESSAGE FROM ERIK

Hi.  My name is Erik.  Thank you for becoming a member of this group.  This should be a fun adventure.  I am going to be a Dungoen Master for this group.  I have spent many years as a mathematician and computer scientist specializing in Japanese and Indian mathematics.  I have also spent many years teaching religion in classes in Manhattan, New York and online through distance learning programs.  I have taught classes and given lectures on Norse Mythology, Polynesian Religion, East Asian Religion, and other religious and historical topics.  Currently, I am also a Kung Fu instructor in Manhattan's China Town and Manhattan's Korea Town.  I use my knowledge of religion, history, and mathematics in the campaigns that I produce and run.  I have very intelligent and unique perspectives towards role playing and have studied role playing games for over 20 years!  Please join me in the adventure of role playing games, CCGs, and table top games.   

_______________________________________________________________________________________________


The CCGs, RPGs, and Wargames! 

This is a list of all the CCGs, RPGs, and Wargames this group hosts.  If you do not see your favorite title on this list, send a message.  We can add other CCGs, RPGs, and Wargames on to the list as is necessary.

• Dungeons and Dragons (All versions)

• Magic The Gathering

• Netrunner

• Star Wars (All versions)

• Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (All versions)

• Ultimate Combat

• Warhammer (All versions)

 ________________________________________________________________________________________________________

How to register for campaigns and tournaments: 

CURRENTLY THERE IS NO COST FOR REGISTERING TO PLAY AN RGP OR TABLE TOP WAR IN THIS GROUP!

This group has 3 different styles of RPG, CCG, and Table Top sessions:

Campaigns

(Only 10 active registrations allowed per campaign!)

This is any storyline that is going to take more than 1 session to complete.  Typically campaigns are going to run until all of the player characters have either died or have finished the campaign objectives.

Flash Sessions

(Only 10 active registrations allowed per flash session!)

These are ideal for beginner players.  These are RPGs, CCGs, or Table Top sessions that are going to be completed the same day that they begin.

Tournaments

(Only 30 active registrations allowed per tournament!) 

Tournaments are going to be Campaigns and Sessions where players are ranked and a prize is going to be given to the winning players.


The current registration cost for Campaigns, Flash Sessions, and Tournaments is free.  You need to register any character, deck, or army with an official Manhattan RPG, CCG, and Table Top Dungeon Master though.  All characters need to be produced and rolled in front of an official group Dungeon Master.  All decks need to be checked and approved by a group Dungeon Master.   All armies need to be checked and approved by a group Dungeon Master.  This is to ensure that characters and stats are not altered and that characters are using their actual rolled stats and not illegally inflated stats.  When the group has more members than space to play, there is going to be a cost of $10.00 a character, $10.00 a deck, and $15.00 an army for registration.  Every group member gets to register 3 characters and 1 army for free.  You do not have to pay for sessions as long as you are using a registered character, or army, that has not died.  Characters can not be reused or reregistered after they die.  Armies and decks can be reused, but need to be reregistered and renamed, after they are defeated in battle. 

Usually, we are going to give at least 3 months notice prior to beginning any campaign.  You need to register for the campaign via meetup. If you are absent from a session during a campaign, you either are given a loss for that battle, or your character is said to be in a limbo and remains in place until you return.  If you do not return for 3 Meetups in a row, your character dies.  You are not allowed to reuse a dead character.


REGISTRION COST:

Characters:  FREE  (There is currently no cost for registering Characters with this group.)

Armies:  FREE (There is currently no cost for registering Armies with this group.)

Decks:  FREE (There is currently no cost for registering Decks with this group.)

_______________________________________________________________________________________________


Thank you,

Erik
results.name: The Manhattan RPG, CCG, and Table Top group!

results.description:
This is the Asian Computer Science and Mathematics Meetup.

This group uses the term Asian to refer to East Asian and South East Asian, not the culture and people of the Middle East.  When we speak of Asian Computer Science and Mathematics we are referring in large to the Computer Science and Mathematical information from China, India, Japan, and Korea.  We are also going to be studying Computer Science and Mathematics from other Asian nations such as; Lao, Mongolia, Nepal, Sri Lanka, and Vietnam.


This is a Meetup group that studies Asian Computer Science and Asian Mathematics. This is not a Meetup group only for Asians.  This is a Meetup group for people in New York who wish to study Asian Computer Science, and Asian Mathematics.  Many Americans use Greek Mathematics and European mathematics as the intellectual basis for their computer science and mathematics research and production.  This group uses Asian computer science and Asian mathematics as the basis for scientific research and production. 

Please join this group if you are interested in Asian Computer Science, Asian Mathematics, and networking with the Asian computer science and Asian mathematics community.

This is an excellent group to make friends with. The size of the membership is small and we encourage interaction among members.  You do not need to be a computer scientist or mathematician to join this group.  You can join this group for social purposes. 


The goals of this group are to:

• Encourage Asian Computer Science

• Encourage Asian Mathematics

• Enable Asian computer scientists and Asian mathematicians a venue for social networking.

• Research and produce knowledge bases of Asian computer science and Asian mathematical information.

• Exist as a group so Asian computer scientists and mathematicians can build successful computer science and mathematics careers.


This Meetup group is a virtual Meetup group.  At least 70% of our Meetups are going to occur in virtual space.  We are also going to be having Meetups in Manhattan, NY, and in Queens, NY.

The groups' Meetups are going to  include;

• Art Projects

• Café Discussions

• Dinner Discussions

• Holiday Events

• Lectures

• Online Meetings

• Online Projects

• Programming Projects


Please join us and become a member of the world of Asian computer science and Asian mathematics.

Thank you,
Erik
results.name: Asian Computer Science and Mathematics Meetup!

results.description:
This is the Midnight Computer Science and Digital Art Club.  The goal of this club is not to have a large Meetup with many people.  The goal is to have a functioning computer science club that has regular virtual meetings.  We are interested in people who are looking to explore alternative uses of computer science technology and who are interested in the social aspects of being a computer scientist or digital artist.

This group is designed to facilitate collaboration between midnight computer scientists and midnight digital artists.

WHAT IS A MIDNIGHT COMPUTER SCIENTIST?  WHAT IS A MIDNIGHT DIGITAL ARTIST?  If you are a computer scientist or Digital artist who spends more time on their computer at night than doing anything else, you probably qualify as a Midnight Computer Scientists or a Midnight Digital Artist.  This is a group that is dedicated to bringing together the scientists of the night to collaborate and design a digital future which is exceptional, artistic, and not necessarily only profitable, or ready for mass consumption.

 

THIS GROUP IS AN EXCELLENT WAY TO MAKE NEW FRIENDS AND SHARPEN YOUR COMPUTER SCIENCE SKILLS AT THE SAME TIME!

You do not need to be a computer science or mathematics professional to join this club.  Amateurs are encouraged to join.  You do not have to be technically inclined to join this club.  You can join for social purposes.

We would like programmers, mathematicians, and digital artists to join the club. We are going to be researching, studying and producing;


• Digital Audio

• Digital Graphics 

• Information Visualization

• Interface Design

• Operating System Design

• Programming Languages

• Virtual Reality


Thank you,
Erik
results.name: Midnight Computer Science and Digital Art Club!

results.description: More info to come soon, but I'll start with why I created this group and what it matters to me :) I’m passionate about positivity, inner health, and that we’re all gorgeous regardless of our unique weight, size, or appearance. I’ve always had fairly good self-esteem and confidence about my body and myself- and wanted the same for others. Of course we’re not going to feel great about ourselves 24/7, but I want to help more people feel happy, healthy, to love and accept themselves, and to realize how incredible they are. For a long time, I had a narrow view of what it meant to have positive body image- mostly dictated by what society said we should judge ourselves by: a specific beauty ideal, weight, what people thought, and by what we were eating. Throughout my personal evolution, I have learned to grow exponentially stronger in the love for my body and discovered this emerging body positive culture. What initially ignited my fire and determination to add to this important conversation about positive body image is the many women I started to meet post high school struggling with serious body image issues, and although I have not personally suffered, their experiences touched me greatly. What matters to me, and what I want to spread throughout my life- be it with the weights classes, Zumba classes, BollyX classes I teach or Meetups I run- is the importance of inner health -to prevent against disease etc- and that our weight and appearance does not determine our beauty nor worth. I'm clear that loving ourselves and our bodies is the best path to take- not negative self-talk or hate. I want to create a community where women can come and talk about a healthy body image and see themselves in a positive, loving light. Join me and let's talk about what it means for you! Love, health, and happiness, Sarah
results.name: NYC Body Positive- Love Yourself and Your Body at

results.description:
Hi Rye Goddesses!

Are you ready to Awaken Your Authentic Self? Women all over the world are waking up to a new renaissance of the heart, soul and body, reclaiming her inner voice and taking steps towards freedom.

For the last five years I have been repairing my relationship with my mental, emotional, physical and spiritual bodies. I overcame breast cancer and had to take a really hard look at all the emotional toxins and mindsetI was carrying around from my relationship with my parents and then men, I was acting out subconsciously, seeking love from a pain point. My wounds were speaking louder than my heart, they began to show me how unhappy I was. Fast forward five years to today. Today I travel and teach throughout North America sharing with women Soul Therapy Seminars and a Journey to Self Love, a two day emotionally empowering discovery of learning how to love yourself, honestly, courageously and with joy. I know you have been yearning to share with a group of women who have your back, seeking support from others who can understand your own journey, acknowledging your pain while uplifting you to greater new heights of self awareness. You've been ready for a long time now, searching and seeking your own journey to self love. I've been there, let me help guide you along the way so that you can get there with the support that you need to accelerate your life to one of freedom and inner peace. I am grateful to be able to share with you all that I have learned on my own journey to self love! 

Join me in this powerful group of women as we explore self love, while learning how to connect deeply to your authentic self, the part of you that is desiring to live a powerfully expressed life. There is that small voice that wants to be heard, understood, acknowledged and loved, that part is your authentic self: your soul.

Blessings,

Carolyn Goldfarb, Licensed Soul Therapist, Spiritual Healer & Guide

Testimonials:

*** I had the pleasure of taking Carolyn's "A Journey To Self Love" group class and it was amazing! She really gets to the heart of what is blocking you, which makes you see the light on where you have been struggling. Carolyn then provided me with suggestions that I could apply in a practical manner to shift out of my discomfort and struggle. She is very thorough and there is also group interaction and sharing which I really liked. She is an inspiration to all and her guidance has helped us see things in different and better way. I am going to sign up for one of her individual sessions as well. I highly recommend it! - Diane O. New York, NY I recently attended Carolyn's Journey to Self-Love workshop in New York City and had a very transcendent experience. She helped me to look inward at obstacles that have kept me from fully loving and forgiving myself. Carolyn has the innate ability to help people become more aware of their inner soul and how powerful they are as a human being. She also guides the group on how they can connect to their spirit guides which showed me how I am always supported and loved. She creates a space that allows you to feel empowered. - Tania E. Bloomfield NJ

*** I sought Carolyn's expertise to help me get past a "block" in my career. Although anxious about the experience, she took a great deal of time to help me understand exactly what was going to happen, how it works and everything in between. She also shared her own PLR experiences so that I felt more comfortable with the process.

Although it's hard to put into words, the experience was transformative and within less than 24 hours, I have a more open heart, mind and a new internal strength. Carolyn truly is a beautiful soul and is passionate about helping others to grow and be happy during this lifetime. If you are looking to understand yourself at a soul level to enjoy a better life, Carolyn can definitely help you get there. I know she hasn't seen the last of me.-Alexandra B., NYC

*** If you never met Carolyn, you should!!! Carolyn has an amazing approach to her work as a Soul Therapist and Past Life Regressionist.

Her approach allows you to discover information about yourself that has ultimately been a barrier to your self-growth. Carolyn allows you to identify these barriers in a very short amount of time that enables you to make changes that will facilitate action, personal satisfaction, inner peace and happiness that we are all seeking.

Carolyn cares deeply for others and has a gift for engaging you in conversation and connecting you with in a different level that allows you to make the change that you have always wanted to, but could not before. As good as it gets!!! :) - Danielle S.. Chicago
results.name: Soul Therapy for Women - Rye New York

results.description:
Rules for Joining this Group: 

• Must be able to read and write Hangul.

• Be able to introduce yourself in your target language. 배우는 언어로 자기소개를 할 수가 있어야 해요.

• Have a picture with your face visible. 프로필 사진에는 얼굴을 보여야 해요.

=====================================

This group is about structured speaking and listening practice. 말하기와 듣기도 연습 할수 있는 모임이에요.

The format is designed to spend an equal amount of time in English and Korean so that the learner can focus on speaking the language and get corrections from a native speaker. Part of the format is trying to say the same things in both languages and practice it many time with different partners. We think that this is a good way to practice both listening and speaking and have a chance to try to incorporate corrections given by each partner. 

=========================

Guidelines: 

• During each conversation try to focus on speaking 100% in that language. If your partner does not understand something or if you need to give an explanation then using the other language is OK. 각 5분씩 대화를 하면서 한가지 언어로 백퍼센트 이야기해 보세요. 상대방이 이해를 못 하면 설명 해주거나 다른 언어로 이야기해도 돼요.

• Try to help your partner by correcting grammar or telling them what is a more natural way to say something. 상대방이 한 말이 틀렸다면 고쳐주고, 뭐가 더 자연스러운지 상대방에게 알려주세요.

results.description:
Are you tired of dieting?  Do you eat when you’re NOT hungry?  Do you use food to comfort yourself?  If this sounds familiar, then you're in the right place.  I have developed the "Eating with a Happy Heart" Program  12 years ago in an effort to help people who use food for the wrong reasons, and who have spent lots of time, money and energy trying to heal this aspect of their life.  I have lived this program because I suffered for many years with this very issue, and so I look forward to sharing how I overcame this challenge. 

I will help you learn how to make peace with food and your body.  You will feel empowered by breaking the four negative eating behaviors.  This process will teach you how to release emotional eating and discover healthier techniques that will end your struggle with food, overeating and body image.  You will listen to your food cravings, and develop greater self-love and awareness in order to achieve wellness in your life.

This group will give you the opportunity to meet other like-minded individuals so that you do not have to feel alone with this issue.  You will feel the benefit from the connection and support of others.  

Each meeting will provide a lesson for discussion, followed by an open format for individual sharing among members.

We will meet bi-monthly on Saturdays for 1 -1/2 hours at American Bulldog Coffee Roasters located at 31 N. Broad St., Ridgewood, NJ.  There is a $30 pre-paid fee for each meeting.  Please bring writing materials with you.  Handouts will be provided as necessary.

For more information, please call me at 201-612-6700 or email robin@phoenixlifecoaching.net

You can visit my website at:  www.phoenixlifecoaching.net
results.name: Ridgewood Overcome Emotional Eating Meetup

results.description: We believe that humanity must shrink its impacts on the environment to make more room for nature, while we reject another, that human societies must harmonize with nature to avoid economic and ecological collapse. results.description:
Welcome to the Orthodox Christian Study Group! The group gathers about once a month to study and talk about a Church inspired topics. The goal of the meetup is to expand our understanding of the Church teachings and at the same time build meaningful friendships with people of common interests. 

Group Guidelines:

The host of the meetup can select the topic, the location, and the study material. The sources used as study material can include Books, Papers, Lectures, Podcasts, Movies, etc, as long as it comes from a credible Orthodox source.  During the studying part of the meetup members ether read or the host gives a short presentation of the material that has been previously posted and shared with the group. If it involves a lecture such as a podcast or you-tube video, the material will be presented from a laptop. We can take turns and host and cover any topic such as Church Art, Science and the Church, Historic Events, Creation, Writings of Saints, etc, but from the perspective of the Orthodox Church. The study part will take place at a conducive to studying environment that will be posted in advance with all other related info at meetup website. A social gathering will follow at a cafe or restaurant during which open dialogue and socializing can take place. Besides Orthodox Christians, the group is open to non-Orthodox and those interested in Orthodoxy. Please sign up if you are interested in being an active member. God Bless!
results.name: Orthodox Christian Study Group

results.description: Do you have a startup idea but don't know how to get moving? We provide hands-on advice to help entrepreneurs establish a team as the first step in making concrete progress toward launching a business. Our events range from live in-person workshops to educational sessions to pitch evaluations to relaxed drinks and networking. When you’re becoming a founder, there’s a lot of advice about things that you’re not ready for. Plus, following a lean model means that you really don’t want to do the third thing first: instead, do the first thing, then the second thing, and so on. We’ve learned what’s critically important at this stage, and we lay it out for you. We want you to *actually* start your startup. Originate it with us.
results.name: Originate Your Startup!

results.description: I've come to realize that many schools that teach you research using SAS provide a lot of theoretical stuff that isn't really useful. Many Biostat courses in Academia give you clean data in a SPREADSHEET without any need to perform data manipulation. In reality, This is not the case in the REAL WORLD Research. After working in the Biostat field for about 10 years, I've combined common tasks I've seen over and over again that are critical for anyone interested in Research using the SAS software. For example, knowing how to merge correctly or what to do BEFORE a merge is a topic instructors often overlook. YOU JUST CAN'T GOOGLE THIS. After bouncing through multiple jobs from hospital to pharmaceuticals, I've combined everything in 9 SAS SESSIONS to give someone the skills to get into research or at least to get them to independently work on their own and use google. http://www.sas.com/en_us/software/university-edition/down... These sessions are also affordable. In part, because I was lucky to have a strong backing of resources and also because I REQUIRE students to bring in their laptops w/ SAS Installed (SAS offers free installation of education editions . I do have about 4 laptops with educational software installed. Course sessions start on 2/18/2016. Please see, www.BasicBiostats.com for more info.
results.name: Intro to Biostatistics and Epi using SAS in Healthcare

results.description:
New York Accredited Investors is a member led organization committed to helping entrepreneurs reach their full potential.

The New York Accredited Investors is comprised of over 50 active members.  Our members are entrepreneurs, CEO's, venture capitalists and business leaders who have founded, funded and built companies in the tech, real estate, retail, law, and health industry.  We come from a wide array of industry expertise and together create an extensive network of entrepreneurial support.

We mentor and coach the entrepreneurs in whom we invest, serve on their boards, provide contacts and assist with team building, strategic planning and fundraising.

Mission:
Our mission is to provide our members with great association and investment opportunities.

Investment Process:
We are not a fund and do not invest as a LLC.   Members collaborate in the due diligence process of opportunities presented but make individual investment decisions.

We’d like to invite you to review our site to learn how we can be a fit for your company. Should you decide to apply for funding through us, you’ll find the steps simple and straightforward.

results.description:
1 Million Cups is a weekly, national program designed to educate, engage, and connect entrepreneurs with peers, mentors, educators and advisors. The 1MC concept is based on the notion that entrepreneurs discover solutions and network over a million cups of coffee. Developed by the Kauffman Foundation (bit.ly/1VnAWOi) in 2012, 1MC is a proven model which has quickly spread to 90+ cities around the country and has been featured in the New York Times, Fast Company, etc.

Each week, the 1MC program offers two local entrepreneurs an opportunity to present their startups to a diverse audience of mentors, advisors, and entrepreneurs. Presenters prepare a 6 minute educational presentation and engage in 20 minutes of feedback and questioning after they present. Entrepreneurs gain insight into possible ways they can improve their businesses, gather real-time feedback, connect with a community that truly cares about their progress, and walk away feeling like they have advanced their business. The audience also learns a great deal from the presentations. Whether this is through passively listening or deeply engaging with the entrepreneurs, there is much to learn every week from these dynamic and diverse communities.
results.name: 1 Million Cups NYC

results.description:
Seriously Fun Mandarin is for anyone who wants to learn or improve their level of Mandarin Chinese. 

We are are group of people who have an interest in China and the Chinese language, but don't like the drill type learning methods that so many groups are based around. 

We want to have serious fun while learning Chinese! The group is open to all people regardless of level. If you are native speaker from China or Taiwan, join us and also improve your English skills. 

Every week, we hope to immerse ourselves in Chinese, so even if you are a beginner, you will learn quickly. We will meet in a cafe for an hour a week, so suggested venues are welcome. Just buy a drink and maybe a snack...and meet new people interested in Chinese. 

Please note: No age is too old, and children are also welcome. (supervised by parents) 

When you join, please indicate your Chinese level and topics of interest. I will plan some activities that suit your interests and language skills. 

A $5 donation is requested at the end of each session. So, if you want to make real progress...and have fun while doing it, join us! 

Shaz

results.description:
LOFT Dining is a monthly social for the LGBT community who want to meet and make new friends and also enjoy an evening out that includes good food. All dinners will be a pre-fix type 3-course meal similar to restaurant week. We plan on a monthly varying schedule of weekdays and weekends. We will be dining at restaurants throughout Westchester, Rockland, and Putnam counties. In addition to socializing, we also seek to promote awareness of the LOFT, increase participation, and promote networking within the community. 

We meet on a monthly varying schedule of weekdays and weekends. Each member pays at the restaurant. The bill at the end of each meal is shared equally between those in attendance.  This avoids the awkwardness and time consuming activity of working out who had what. This should be no problem because the dinners will be pre-fix and all members will pay the same – except for extras and alcohol.  

We ask each diner for a $10 deposit to secure his/her place and this is taken off the final bill.

results.description:
As a business owner or entrepreneur, are you serious about using networking to grow your business? 


Networking matters whether you want new customers, repeat business, referrals or attention of potential investors. However, it is seldom taught anywhere and consequently most networkers fail to get adequate return out of their investment in business networking meetings. 

Business networking is not about exchanging cards!

There are tools such as elevator pitches, one-on-ones, strategic alliances, follow ups and social media that you need to master. Whether you are a pro or a newbie, our tools help you tremendously in honing your business networking skills. Our events are quality events that help you grow into a power networker who gets real business out of networking meetings. We also strive to create a synergistic referral network for you. 

At our events you can: 


• Mingle with like minded individuals and create strong business relationships.

• Reach everyone in the meetup through elevator pitches.

• Take part in our highly successful interactive educational programs.

• Learn more about the mindset and skills of business ownership.

• Learn about and create strategic alliances.

• Become a spotlight speaker and promote your business. 

About myself: I have been organizing one of the highest ranked NY Connect and Grow business networking group on meetup with 4200+ members and felt a need of a networking group which teaches people how to network. Looking forward to meet you at our next event!
results.name: New York Business Networking for Success

Of course, discussions always flow easier with a glass of wine or two, so there will be that too. results.description: Do you have a pile of playbills hidden in your room? Hoard ticket stubs? Have playlists on your IPOD devoted to the likes of Kelli O'Hara and Sutton Foster? WELL MY FRIENDS ... YOU ARE NOT ALONE. Welcome ! Meet your people! The theater people. The Broadway Badasses. We spend most of our disposable income on the arts and love to brag about the shows we've seen. We can throw random musical lyrics into any conversation. We WILL wait for 3 hours in the freezing cold for rush tickets to The Color Purple. We say things like "Well... I could pay $35 for a cab to the airport... BUT THAT's A THEATER TICKET. SO I'll SUBWAY IT." We stage door it. We're Devoted. This group is for the theater fans out there that want to meet other Broadway Badasses. I created this group because I just moved here and need to meet some of my people! JOIN! LET'S BE FRIENDS! We can go see a show and talk about it after! We can debate for hours how Kelli O'Hara should have won a Tony for The Bridges of Madison County. We can go for coffee and cry when our favorite show closes early!
results.name: They say the neon lights are bright ON BROADWAY.

results.description:
Thank you for your interest in our meet-up, and we look forward to not only getting to know you -- but understanding what is your "Why”. Why do you want to make a difference? And, what are you willing to contribute to make that difference happen?

All too often, people talk about problems, but then do nothing themselves to help make the situation better. Others, want to get involved in something meaningful, but find their choices limited to handing out food at a soup kitchen or food bank ... while others just walk a few miles once a year.

While all these things are helpful, ask yourself are these questions ...

• Are the activities you are doing really significant?

• If you didn't do it, would it still get done?

• Are you unintentionally discriminating against others in what you're doing?

• Are you really impacting the lives of others in a meaningful, long-lasting way?

• Are you able to continuing build on what you're doing to have greater and greater impact?

• Are you activity affecting your community?

• Are you working on positive change for your country?

Our social activism club doesn’t discriminate in membership acceptance. We accept people from all different backgrounds, ages, educational levels, income, religion, gender, country of origin. 

There are only three things you have to have in order to be successful in our organization:  

(1) Desire 

(2) Determination

(3) Coachability/Team Player

So join us and work on these amazing programs:

• Help Petition President Obama to Declare August “National Kids Month”  

• PSA, Television, Video, Print & Social Media Programs -- Pre, Post & Production

• Books, Blogs, Articles -- From Writing to Design To Publishing & Marketing

• Youth & Adult Educational Programs  

• Social Responsibility School & Community Clubs  

• Community Learn & Earn Programs  

• Special Event Marketing, PR, Coordination, Management  

• Fundraising, Grants, Sponsorships & Partnerships  Much Much More! 


So, regardless of your educational or work background -- join us and make a difference!
results.name: NYC Social Responsibility Movers & Shakers Activist Club

results.description:
Welcome to the FASHIONISTAS in Business Meetup! I'm so excited that you're interested in taking part in this wonderful, up-and-coming community of like-minded women who are passionate about fashion and determined to build successful businesses doing what they love—Fashion!

As a swimwear designer, I felt very secluded and lonely working on my business. It wasn’t until I started my Coaching Certification, where I met other like-minded ladies, that I noticed my business starting to improve! 

It made me realize how important it is to have a community of peers who are doing the same thing as you. Not only sharing ideas and strategies to grow your business, but also to have a place to go when things don’t go as expected and you need a little inspiration or cheering up!

That’s why I created my VIP Facebook Group, because nothing compares to real-time support and live discussions with entrepreneurs who have been in your shoes.  

And you can join now: https://www.facebook.com/groups/MarketingforFashionistas/

However, for the lucky ones who live in NY, I decided to create a Monthly Meetup since nothing compares the face to face interaction!!!

My Meetups won't be just to make connections (which I know how important it is to your success) but also a bit of Training! 

Yes, FREE Training from moi! Each month we'll meet to talk about a specific topic that will help you move closer to your Dream Fashion Biz! If that does not blow up your socks down, I don't know what will :-)

Examples of topics to be covered include:

- Facebook Ads to Boost Sales of Your Products or Services

- How to Create Raving Fans for Your Brand

- My 5 Secrets to Earn $5K - $10K Consistently

And much, much more!


This group will be a place where you can get the support and help you need to succeed!

When you do join, please take the time to introduce yourself, and tell us a little bit about your Fashion Biz!

The only rule... You must be a Fashion Entrepreneur: Fashion retailers, boutique owners, fashion designers, jewelry designers, stylists, etc.

Also, do keep in mind that this is a fun, friendly and supportive group, so we need to keep it that way :)  

If you need more support, please email me at agustina@marketingforfashionistas.com

Enjoy, and get involved!

Agustina xx
results.name: FASHIONISTAS in Business

results.description: Talk & discussion: With the publication of Job, Joseph Roth's 1930 novel about a Galician Jewish family forced to immigrate to New York, Roth's literary reputation skyrocketed. His novel The Radetzky March, which appeared two years later, is almost universally recognized as a classic. Yet Roth’s earlier work, in which he probingly examined the upheavals of his time—particularly the Russian revolution—have only recently been rediscovered. In the United States, a new anthology of his early reportage, The Hotel Years, has just been published by New Directions, and in Germany his newly published essays on Russia have been celebrated by critics and readers alike. Are we experiencing an international Roth Renaissance? Jan Bürger and George Prochnik will discuss one of the most important and enigmatic writers of the modern era, and provide insights into his astonishing body of work with the aid of manuscripts and letters from the Leo Baeck Institute, New York, and the German Literature Archive, Marbach. Jan Bürger is a literary scholar and author. He wrote his dissertation about Hans Henny Jahnn, belongs to the founding editors of the Berlin journal Literaturen, and has worked since 2002 at the German Literature Archive. In addition to numerous contributions to journals and newspapers (including Die Zeit and the Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung, he has written Der gestrandete Wal: Das maßlose Leben des Hans Henny Jahnn (2003), Benns Doppelleben oder wie man sich selbst zusammensetzt (2006), Max Frisch: Das Tagebuch (2011) and Der Neckar: Eine literarische Reise (2013). He is also the editor of a number of events including Ich bin nicht innerlich. Annäherungen an Gottfried Benn (2003), Friedrich Schiller: Dichter, Denker, Vor- und Gegenbild (2007), Liebe ist Quatsch. Briefe an Ellinor by Hans Henny Jahnn (with Sandra Hiemer, 2014) Briefwechsel by Alfred Andersch and Max Frisch (2014), as well as Reisen in die Ukraine und nach Russland by Joseph Roth (2015). George Prochnik has written for the The New York Times, The New Yorker, Bookforum and the LA Review of Books. His most recent book The Impossible Exile: Stefan Zweig at the End of the World received the National Jewish Book Award for Biography/Memoir in 2014. He is editor-at-large for Cabinet magazine. Photographs reproduced thanks to the generosity of the Leo Baeck Institute. Details Language: English Price: Free admission +1 212 4398700 info@newyork.goethe.org 01/13/16 6:30pm Goethe-Institut New York 30 Irving Place New York, NY 10003
results.name: The Unmendable Self: New Perspectives on Joseph Roth

results.description: Hey Guys, T21 Rocks! was created by the parents of two rocking little girls, Samantha and Marilyn. Who were born on the same day with a little extra chromosome - Down Syndrome. Their mommas -Iris and Larissa- craved a community in which they could feel accepted, united, and supported. Sammy's dad - Jamie - longed for a network of strong fathers dedicated to their families and the advancement of their children. The T21 Rocks! family wants to be there to show the world what all individuals with Trisomy 21 are capable of - beginning with their families. We are based out of NYC, and all of our events are located around the city. We want to let other families know they are not alone on their journey. We support each other and provide advice, strength, and resources where necessary. We encourage parents and family members along, and we will be there to help celebrate your loved ones as they achieve their goals and dreams! Our children have no limits, they can do and be whatever they want because, T21 ROCKS!!
results.name: T21 ROCKS! Down Syndrome Meetup Support Group

results.description: Are you students/professionals who want to build a satisfying and successful career? Have you ever experienced a time when your boss or your partner couldn’t understand you? Do you want to build meaningful relationships? Most importantly, do you want to become more happy and satisfied? If you answered yes to any of those questions, MBTI Enthusiasts is for you! Through MBTI Personality Types we will learn more about ourselves and understand our differences with other people. I created this group to bring together people who have an interest in the Myers Briggs Type Indicator in an informal/relaxed environment where we can learn from each other through interactive activities and intellectual discussions about 16 types. Whether you are expert or dummy in MBTI Personality Types, we welcome you! This is the place to be if you'd like to socialize with people who share an awareness of the importance of personality. We encourage to hold space for each other to learn about and understand our differences. results.description: We are visionary or global parents, perhaps bi-racial, or multi-ethnic, perhaps with multi-cultural children.  What we have in common is our belief that one of the best gifts we can give our children is the gift of duo or multilingualism.  But its not as easy as it seems.  Especially when only one parent speaks a second language; or neither parent does; or our child is insisting upon English; or there are no immersion programs nearby or affordable, or our child already has too much on his/her plate.  Our group explores what works and doesn't work.  When is the best time and age to introduce another language, and what are the best approaches parents and educators can use.  We explore all possibilities, from moving abroad, to hiring a Nanny, to enrolling in an immersion school or Saturday classes, to homeschooling, and more.   We have discussions, playdates, movie nights, and story times.  We are unrelenting and determined to give the gift of language!
results.name: Parents Trying to Create Multilingual Kids in NYC

results.description:
Finally they confirmed my diagnosis of metastatic cancer; which I have always known but secretly hope that I might be wrong..... Now what? Well, there are admirable heroes who can handle cancer diagnoses with grace and compassion; not for themselves solely but mostly for the sake of people around them. They are my idols but I knew from the get-go that I am absolutely not yet one of them. I want to scream, throw a tantrum, kicking up like a baby while whining and sobbing and swearing on the floor. I don't act like this all the time though because it requires a bit physical strength. Never less, I believe that we, the ordinary people, have the right to react to cancer however we wish to, and those superheroes need a break every now and then too. So I started this group with one goal in mind- for my fellow cancer carriers to be openly emotional, freely expressional, and swear at cancer until we exhausted all dirty words we know, then we go shopping and eating and dancing like no tomorrow. And then, we gather ourselves and get on with our ordinary life and live as healthy as one can be, until the next meetup. :) 


Yup, our menu includes screaming exercise (a.k.a Friday night dance club), anger management (a.k.a boxing with the cute gym coach), stress release exercise (a.k.a swearing phrase spelling bee, crying competition), group field trips (e.g. reiki, craniosacral therapy, princess spa, hair shedding shower, wig fitting party), and world peace, seriously (a.k.a trips around the USA and the world to drag our fellow cancer carriers out of their shells or their superhero masks, and share a lot of FUN and SHIT dealing with cancer! Or anything you disparately need a group support, just holler!
results.name: I've Got Cancer, LOL- NYC

The lack of diversity in tech has been a part of the national conversation in recent years, and while it would be great to start a group that will solve this issue, we have humbler ambitions. results.description:
Hi, I’m Wendy Hung. I’m a transitional coach and transforming lives is my passion. I've moved more than 20 times in my lifetime, have worked with fortunate 500, SMEs, am currently an entrepreneur and a mother of a beautiful daughter after a scare with ovarian cancer that led me to believe that miracle and magic do exist. In other words, CHANGES is my best friend.

Over the last couple of years, I've been involved in the transformation of others' lives through Accomplishment Coaching and Landmark. I created '2nd Chance, 2nd Life' because I believe we deserve a 2nd chance to live the life that we love.

I'm here to support people to embrace major changes in their lives (e.g. cancer, relocation, career changing, starting a business) and to empower their choice (or the lack of it). We will have activities that will generate light, love, connection and strength, together. You will create and experience the connection and love with self, others and our lives, with power, by design. 

Come out and join us at our next 2nd Chance, 2nd Life event. We attract a wonderful and inspiring group of people. I look forward to connecting with you!

Warm Regards,

Wendy Hung

results.description:
We started our first meetup group in San Francisco back in March 2012.  It now has over 7,000 members (14,000 in all the Bay Area).  With the success of our events, this year we're expanding to the New York, NY!

Our goal is to provide a fun low-pressure environment/activity where individuals can connect one-on-one. Sometimes it's intimidating to go to a group activity all by yourself. Or sometimes you get lost in a big group event – you talk to everyone but get to know no one. Wouldn't it be nice to have a date at a fun event?

With our activities, you're welcome to come alone or with a date. And if you need a date, visit HowAboutADate.com. (1) post a date - what, when, & where, (2) review replies, (3) choose your date and go out. Dating Simplified! Do what you love... and love will find you.

Yes, this is a different Meetup group – it combines great activities with (optionally) bringing a date for that activity. We simply want you to have a great time (i.e. enjoy fun dates not "interview dates" or high pressure dates). And feel free to suggest great "first date" activities and even post links to other great meetup events. We're not here to compete with other meetups, only to support and enrich the Singles Community!

There is no age requirement for our group, except that you're over 18 of course. Our members range from 20 to 70 y.o. We're all about making friends first and enjoying the company of others and doing wonderful activities throughout New York. Cool couples are welcome to attend our great events as well. 

Cheers!
results.name: HowAboutADate - New York

You will learn and apply the 8 lessons of the Stanford Creativity course , you will be guided on the journey of developing a vision and plan around your goals and challenges, and then applying the powerful Creative Insight tools to make your vision a reality.
Most of the learning in this program does not require dedicated time, but rather attention and practice to integrate new ideas into your day- to-day activities. This is not something separate from your personal and professional day to day, but rather a much more powerful way to go about your day to day.

Whether you are in the middle of a job transition, a life transition, or simply stuck in one area of your life, this course is filled with practical tools and powerful techniques that will ignite self-discovery, awaken personal insight, and empower you to step fully into the life you desire!

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in prototyping user experiences for Mobile, Desktop, Wearables and beyond! I started this group to meet other prototyping enthusiasts and learn from each other.

Prototyping is something that can be useful to different people from UX/UI Designers to Product Designers, from Product Managers to Entrepreneurs – and in general to anyone that wants to communicate an idea for a product, service or feature. All skills levels are welcome. Looking forward to meeting everyone!

This group topics:

• What should you prototype and with what tools? Article I wrote on the right tools here

• Discuss why it's good to prototype early and often 

• Overview the panorama of prototyping tools out there like the ones listed here

• Share favorite prototyping tools and techniques (Like InVision or Marvel, Pixate, Principle for Mac...)

• Best ways to create assets for prototype? Pros and cons of using Photoshop, Illustrator vs Sketch App

• Share prototypes and get feedback

• Advanced Prototyping: Using front end coding technologies HTML, JS, or backend (Rails, etc)

• Beyond visual prototypes: using SMS interfaces? Audio? VR? Position based interfaces? 


Feel free to suggest additional topics! :)

Francesco


PS: Depending on the group interests we might schedule workshops too.
results.name: Prototyping User Experiences NYC Meetup

results.description: In June 2015 I assumed the role as US Director for the Israel Venture Network, an innovative venture philanthropy/impact investing organization focused on strengthening social businesses in Israel that provide employment & career advancement opportunities to the country's most vulnerable populations. We manage four social business investment funds and are currently incubating 30+ portfolio companies. This group is for professionals and philanthropists who are find themselves at the intersection of business & philanthropy, looking for opportunities to leverage their investment and business skills for social change in Israel. I wanted to be sure to personally invite and encourage members of this group to attend our upcoming IVN Yozma Fund Launch event on January 27 from 5:30-7:30pm at a very cool social business here in NYC (Colors Restaurant.) We will be celebrating the launch of our ground-breaking social investment fund - created in partnership with the Israeli government, philanthropy & business - and will be featuring expert speakers to talk more about social impact investing and the growing social business ecosystem. The Fund’s Social Mission is to create an opportunity for sustainable social change by investing in and mentoring social businesses that focus on vocational training and employment for: Youth-at- risk, People with special needs, Recovering addicts, Released convicts, Chronically unemployed, Elderly, and Single parents. The invitation can be viewed here: http://us12.campaign-archive2.com/?u=469cc2d80f2cd1713a799cb15&id=a7f9a36678 Included on the invite is the link to RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/celebrate-the-launch-of-the-ivn-yozma-fund-tickets-20406209522

You will learn step by step with plenty of practice and repetition in a no-rush environment. There are people who learn by watching while others learn by understanding what they see. results.description:
If you are looking for freedom, in your job, in your finances, or in your relationship, then you are in the right place! 

Freedom doesn't come from the external world, it can only come from inside you. This is a group for courageous people who are ready to look within, realize who they really are, and start living a life they desire with more inner freedom and joy. 

I'm Mandy, I'm a certified intuition coach, and my mission is to help people know themselves and live the life they want. In this group, we will have regular gatherings in the form of free classes, paid workshops, coaching groups, exploration circles, and healing sessions. 

Topics will include, but are not limited to the following. And these are general ideas, each meeting will have more details about the specific topic: 

• Happiness: Why money can't buy it? How to get more of it? 

• Freedom: What is it? What are we chasing? How can we really get it?

• Love: What is love beyond romantic love? What are we really looking for? Why we would die for it? 

• Emotions: What's the truth hidden behind them? How do we judge emotions? How do we use emotions? What do emotions take away from us? 

• Healing: What is healing? Why do we refuse to heal? What are we gaining by not healing? And what are we giving? 

Looking forward to sharing our exciting journeys together. To find more information about me, check out my website: http://whexp.com
results.name: Live the Life You Love NYC

As those looking to dive, lovers of the ocean or those qualified divers there are ample opportunities to get out and touch our oceans. 

Working with groups out in Florida, St. Croix and worldwide there are opportunities to get out and learn to dive or just dive again right here in New York! We are on a mission to increase awareness of our ever changing oceans. Come join us in this call to action to help save our ocean friends.

results.description:
Does speaking in front of a group sends a chill down your spine?  Do you feel the butterfly flutter in your stomach everytime you get up to speak in front of your peers?  You are not alone. In fact, Glossophobia or the fear of public speaking is the number one fear for most people.  Do you want to know what is the number two fear? It is fear of death. That's right. More people are afraid to speak in public than that are afraid to die!  Fortunately there is help.

Toastmasters International is a non-profit educational institution primarily focused on helping aspiring leaders communicate effectively. Its award-winning program has helped thousands of members across the globe improve on their speaking skills for the last 90 years. 

Art of Speaking was founded in 2002 as a Toastmasters club and has been instrumental in mentoring hundreds of confident speakers.  Membership in Toastmasters club is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. At a cost that is little more than a Pumpkin Spice Latte a month, it is also one of the most cost-effective skill-building tools available anywhere. Visit one of our meetings to understand the program and its benefits. There is no charge to attend as a guest.
results.name: Art of Speaking Toastmasters Club - North Edison

This group is for entrepreneurial managers who have to navigate building strong teams and developing talent without the benefit of large corporate training programs. 

Meet like minded people who want to make a difference in the world by bringing people together, building teams, and developing leaders.

As an entrepreneur you know that people matter. Through workshops, panels, discussion groups, and facilitated conversations we will explore the leadership skills and mindsets needed to build strong teams where people thrive. 

Looking forward to learning with you! 

Yehudi 

Yehudi Meshchaninov is the founder of Leadership Labs NY (LLNY), a consulting firm dedicated to helping leaders build engaging and productive teams. His focus includes leadership development, group-dynamics, and organizational agility. Prior to founding LLNY, Yehudi served as Director of Leadership Development for The New American Initiative, an educational reform organization. Yehudi is an AMA certified MBTI coach, conflict mediator, lecturer at Yeshiva University's Office of School Partnerships leadership program, and a doctoral student at Columbia University. He is also a proud Millennial, Brooklynite, and improv fan.

results.description:
Inspired by the online community of Insight Timer (the meditation app), we're creating a local peer-led group for those who seek to explore a mindfulness practice and how it applies to our lives. By creating a time and place to meet weekly, we can support, share and learn from one another. We will meet on Wednesday evenings for a guided meditation, followed by a group discussion. Focus will be on the Buddhist mindfulness tradition, however all are welcome - new or experienced meditators from any tradition who endeavor to develop a meaningful practice.

Wednesday evenings from 7:45-8:45pm at The Unitarian Church in downtown Summit - 4 Waldron Avenue, Summit, NJ (on the corner of Springfield Ave and Waldron Ave)

* You don't need to belong to this (or any) church to attend this Meetup. Our group is an independent meditation group.

No charge, but dana (a suggested $10 donation) will be gratefully accepted.

* We also have another Meetup group called MONDO Morning Mindfulness Meditation, specifically for our Friday morning meditation class at MONDO (426 Springfield Ave in Summit, 3rd floor), taught by longtime meditation teacher, Kerry Rasp, on (most) Friday mornings from 10:30-11:30am. Please message me or join on Meetup for specific details and dates.
results.name: Insight Summit- Weekly Drop-in Mindfulness Meditation Group

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested to "Think and Grow Rich".

Welcome everyone who would like to THINK and Grow Rich!
I would like to invite you to join us for a Webinar series (free and no obligations). We will have our meetings in webinar format on a weekly basis and will read and study one of most readable book in human history "Think and Grow Rich" written by Napoleon Hill. Napoleon Hill dedicated 25 years to writing this book and finding out the keys to success.
The object of these Webinars and this book is to help all those who seek success, to learn the art of changing their minds from failure consciousness to success consciousness.
Napoleon Hill: “When you begin to think and grow rich, you will observe that riches begin with a state of mind, with definiteness of purpose, with little or no hard work. You, and every other person, ought to be interested in knowing how to acquire that state of mind which will attract riches. I spent twenty-five years in research, analyzing more than 25,000 people, because I, too, wanted to know “how wealthy men become that way.” 
Consulting Engineer and long-time associate of Thomas A. Edison, said— “This is not a novel. It is a textbook on individual achievement that came directly from the experiences of hundreds of America’s most successful men. It should be studied, digested, and meditated upon. No more than one chapter should be read in a single night. The reader should underline the sentences which impress him most. Later, he should go back to these marked lines and read them again. A real student will not merely read this book, he will absorb its contents and make them his own.”
results.name: Brooklyn Book Club Meetup Think and Grow Rich

This group is for ladies who work on the Upper East Side and want to meet new faces at lunch. Working for a small business, I know what that feels like. Even if you’ve got great colleagues and reading is sometimes fun… Maybe you work in a large business or you work from home or you work for yourself and also agree that you want some new conversations at lunch.

Maybe you’re a compulsive worker.

Maybe it’s cold outside and you need a good reason to get away from your desk.

Disengage. Enjoy lunch and some different conversations. Make new friends, network, just have fun--for an hour.

As we are working ladies, this isn’t meant to be an all afternoon affair but something fun and energizing during the lunch hour.

We’ll meet every couple of weeks or more often if others want to host, at affordable restaurants on the Upper East Side, most likely between 77th and 86th Street. When the weather warms up we can find some outdoor options as well. – I read an article about #leanintolunch and it inspired me to do this! -

results.description: How to be an Artist is an one night workshop by a working artist for actors, performers, artists, musicians and writers. We will cover:  How to make a Living as an Artist. Overcoming the myth of the Starving Artist. Finding your character. Tapping the Unconscious for Creativity and Originality. How to deal with other people heckling you, including your family, friends, peers, critics and even yourself. How to weather the emotional storms of being an artist. How to balance your art and your day job. Master Lee has performed on Sesame Street and Riker’s Island. He is a native New Yorker, legendary street performer and comic. He has written and produced two plays. He has taught Tai-chi & Chi Kung for over 30 years as well as Performance Studies at NYU. He has won two MothSlams. He is writing a book entitled, How to be an artist and not lose your mind. This event is a donation, pay what you can. Email him at masterleelovesyou@gmail.com to reserve a spot.
