results.description: The Rising Strong™ Workshop is a highly experiential methodology based on the research of Dr. Brené Brown, the author of Daring Greatly, Rising Strong and The Gifts of Imperfection. This work is based on the simple physics of vulnerability: If we are brave enough, often enough, we will fall. What does that mean? We all have a story about an experience; a situation, a conversation that made us feel bad, sad, hurt, and ashamed. It can be a story of personal heartbreak, a story from our childhood, a relationship and/or a professional struggle. It's the story where we think we are not good enough; smart enough, thin enough, or even not worthy of being loved. That we’re a bad friend, parent, spouse, boss, son, or daughter. When we don't resolve these feelings, they stop us from having courage in our day-to-day lives. Who should take this workshop? This work is for anyone that wants to: - Explore a story of struggle - Get curious about the emotions that keep us stuck in our story - Learn how owning our story of struggle gives us the power to write a brave new ending How does Rising Strong work? The work is broken down into three acts and is facilitated through discussion, video and written exercises. Act I: The Reckoning – We Walk Into Our Story. Act II: The Rumble – Owning Our Story. Act III: The Revolution – Process Becomes Practice. We write a new ending to our story based on our key learnings and use this new, braver story to change how we engage with the world and to ultimately transform the way we live, love, parent, and lead
results.name: Rising Strong: Let's write a new ending to our story

results.description:
Why "People Magazine"? Well a friend used to joke with me that "People" is my bible. I can't really debate this as it is indeed one of my most favorite guilty pleasures. Most of the shows I've watched, movies I've seen and books I've read...over the past 20 years have resulted from the featured suggestions found in the magazine . For me it's always been an extremely reliable source of pics that match my personal taste.

The purpose of this book group is to appeal to others who also enjoy reading the same kinds of books I like (they don't necessarily need to be featured in "People") so that we can have a relatively easy time selecting books that matches our collective taste of primarily pop fiction (along with some non fiction/memoirs...) which we all can agree on and feel happy about.

Ideally we will meet monthly at a somewhat easy to get to central location for a group discussion. Below is a list of some books that have been previous featured pics to give you an idea of the types of books we will be reading. 

Looking forward to meeting you.


Orphan Train, Christina Baker Klin

When Breath Becomes Air, Paul kalathanini

The Girl on the Train, Paula Hawkins

Atul Gawande, Being Mortal

Going Clear, Lawrence Wright

results.description:
Anyone else in the East Village or neighboring areas interested in the ancient prayers of the Christian tradition?

My vision for this group is to see people gather in homes or Tompkins Square Park throughout the year to pray through the rich texts of established trinitarian Christian prayer books like the Book of Common Prayer (BCP) or the psalms. For Christians and non-Christians alike, these texts offer beautiful ways of expressing our needs, hopes, fears, and desires, and require no mustering of poetic language or contriving penitence. Instead, one can authentically pray through the words carefully chosen throughout preceding generations, tested and proved trustworthy. One example is Compline, found here (http://justus.anglican.org/resources/bcp/Compline&amp...) a rich liturgical way to end a day alone at home or in the communal company of others.

This is a new Meetup, so please contact me if you have any questions, suggestions or input!

Peace of Christ,
Drake
results.name: East Village Common Prayer

results.description:
We meet twice weekly at the Kingsbridge Library in the Bronx to meditate and experience the innate connection we have with each other and the energy that created us.

We usually have fluent English, Russian and Spanish speakers in the class. All nationalities are welcome.

What can you expect? Relax. It's Easy. Whether you are looking for a practical method to handle stress, a life too full of priorities, or for insights into the meaning of life, into spiritual growth, this will help.

Sahaja Yoga Meditation is unique in ways too numerous to explain here. Unlike other forms of meditation or yoga, this is not something you "do" - it is more about a state of becoming, of "being" rather than doing, a living process that transforms your life from within.

Classes are:

led by experts, with thousands of hours of practical experience, deep knowledge and skill. In addition, there are often people training to become instructors who are happy to offer individual guidance.

tailored to the needs of the attendees. A starter session will be given if there are newcomers. New techniques and insights are always available for regulars. Advanced techniques will also be explored.

no more than an hour. Not long, considering the benefits can last a lifetime. They begin with a brief introduction followed by 30-40 minutes of instruction, and meditation practice.

What Sahaja Meditation Can Do For You

Sahaja Meditation is good for heart, mind, body and soul. It's all about energy — Kundalini Energy — and everyone has it. Sahaja Meditation is a simple technique that lets you tap into that energy and harness its power to become better balanced and better connected to yourself — emotionally, physically, and spiritually. It's easy. Anyone can do it. 

Here are just a few specific benefits Sahaja Meditation offers… 
• Immediate stress relief and long-term stress management 
• Improve physical and emotional health and boost long-term resilience 
• Improve overall personality and relationships 
• Balance personal and professional responsibilities 
• Take control of your life; control negative emotions such as anger, fear, anxiety, guilt 
• Improve cognitive functioning: focus, clarity, decision-making and problem-solving skills, enhanced creativity 

What is Sahaja Meditation? 

How does Sahaja Meditation differ from other popular forms of meditation? On the surface, Sahaja Meditation has a lot in common with other forms of meditation. But what's unique to Sahaja is the ability to awaken and connect to your Kundalini Energy and influence the movement of this energy up through your body's seven primary energy centers known as chakras, to achieve physical and emotional well-being and ultimately establish a spiritual connection. 

How does energy flow work? It flows through each of your energy centers or chakras, energizing, nurturing and balancing them. Think of your Inner Energy system as a flute with seven holes — each hole representing a chakra, and your inner energy representing the air that is blown through the flute. If the flute's holes are unobstructed, the flute can produce melodious, harmonious music in the hands of a skilled musician. And so it is with your chakras. When they're clear and free of obstructions, your inner energy flows through your body smoothly, achieving a harmonious balance. 

Once awakened, you'll find that Sahaja Meditation makes it easy to meditation effortlessly. Most forms of meditation don't allow you to easily actualize the energy on Day 1. The reason is that Sahaja Meditation has the unique ability to achieve the powerful state of thoughtless awareness, quickly and effortlessly. What is thoughtless awareness? Think of it as purified attention, a state of maximum energy flow during which your mind is calmed and gradually emptied of all distractions and negative thoughts and feelings. Sahaja Meditation techniques allow you to extend that fraction-of-a-second gap between one thought and the next to remain in a thoughtless state for as long as you wish. Thoughtless awareness is a much-needed break from the thoughts that constantly bombard us all day long. 

Overview.

The primary focus of Sahaja Meditation classes, especially for beginners, is awakening and experiencing the energy with the goal of achieving thoughtless awareness. We'll provide a brief overview of the subtle energy system so that you can understand the sensations you feel within your body and correlate your experience to real physical and mental attributes. But experience is always valued over knowledge. In other words, the proof of the pudding is in the eating, not in learning how to make elaborate pudding recipes or discussing how wonderful the pudding tastes. 

If you continue to practice Sahaja Meditation, you'll discover and experience, step by step, your own energy centers and their associated qualities. Once you're able to consistently feel the energy and have experienced noticeable differences in your cognitive and emotional states, you can explore more advanced techniques, such as clearing and healing the chakras. You'll learn how the energy centers play a vital role in our evolutionary process of becoming better human beings and experience holistic improvement on all planes — physical, cognitive, emotional and spiritual. In the ultimate and most advanced phases, you may choose to use Sahaja Meditation to discover your inner spiritual self and how you can evolve to higher realms of spirituality. For many, Sahaja is much more than just a temporary solution or quick relief. It is a journey, rather than a destination. 

Ultimately, Sahaja classes can provide a complete course on meditation and spirituality, which you can continue to experiment with and verify at every step. Just as no two life experiences are exactly alike, no two Sahaja Meditation experiences are exactly alike. You can explore at your own pace, in your own way. There are no rules, restrictions or rituals. Sahaja is entirely Do-It-Yourself. And we are always available to help. 

There's no pressure to continue attending classes. You can come once or twice and never come back again or you can attend classes weekly. Many find that attending classes weekly is just what they need to recharge their batteries. 

The power of collective meditation. 

Collective meditation in an optimized environment can be exhilarating and rejuvenating. In fact, generally, the larger the group, the better the experience. Collective meditation is also likely to help you progress faster in the initial weeks, as compared to meditating at home, alone.
results.name: Meditation Classes, Kingsbridge NYPL, Bronx - Always Free

results.description: Thank you for your interest in this new community of minority, women, and other diversity group members who are either currently or seeking to become a ” government certified (M/WBE) business enterprise, and/ or simply desiring to explore other methodologies of business capitalization, growth, utilizing tech and new media to develop new business and career opportunities. Note, that City, State, and Federal government agencies are required by law to award a certain annual percentage of their contracts to Certified M/WBE business enterprises. Therefore, these agencies are actively seeking to educate and train you with regards to the necessary steps to obtain M/WBE certification. Once certified, a M/WBE is eligible for one- on-one technical assistance as well as the right to attend training workshops on government contracting, as well as the chance to receive mentoring and info on opportunities to partner with other businesses and agencies. To assist both public sector organizations as well as current and prospective Certified M/WBE business enterprises, this group aspires to organize networking events to enable members to meet with both governmental M/WBE officials, as well as executives from currently certified M/WBE enterprises and/ or their partner businesses and/ or agencies. At these events, members will benefit from face to face networking with peers and obtain invaluable information not only the certification process, but also on future agency training, mentoring, and contracting opportunities. In addition, local businesses, non-profits as well as educational and governmental institutions all face the same dilemma. Human resource departments throughout the region are seeking to fill as many vacancies as possible with minority, women, and other diversity group candidates. Therefore, with the community’s help, support, and participation, this group aspires to organize networking meetups to enable members to discover new career opportunities, and on occasion obtain useful professional development too! Members will benefit from face to face networking with expanding and hiring employers, educational institutions, non-profits, and government institutions to gain knowledge and insight into future employment as well career training opportunities We welcome your questions, suggestions, and participation I welcome your input, suggestions, participation, and most important of all co- sponsorship inquires  & recommendations! and  success to all!

results.description:
The School of Being explores what it means to be. Our gatherings focus on learning about presence and mindfulness based techniques through dialog, guided activities, and practice. We will touch on subjects related to meditation, deep listening, the masculine and feminine, the inner child, the inner critic, self acceptance, and various tools for personal insight and transformation.

We will unpack the many layers of being through direct experience and structured group interaction. Meditation is often an inward journey. Rarely do we take that journey, the journey of deep presence, together with other people. How do we practice being deeply present, not just with ourselves, but with those around us? How do we understand ourselves more deeply through the lens of other people? How do we connect with our deepest sense of being moment to moment in everyday life?

results.description:
Join with Caution: This book club may lead to making new friends, traveling, fem-preneurship, and reading wine labels.

Plot: Readers & Shakers is a hybrid book club based in New York City and is best suited for (but not limited to) women ages 21 through 40-something. Each month, a book (genre will vary) is carefully curated to inspire us members to live our best life! We host intriguing book club discussions and incorporate our book's premises and settings into fun, real-life activities & travel. There are no reading or attendance prerequisites to join our meet-ups, so this club is perfect for the new girl in town or the busy boss-babe.  

~What is a "hybrid" book club? This group connects like-minded women, not just novice readers, and we bond beyond book discussions. Let's say our book's setting takes us on a literary journey to Washington D.C. or even Europe... well, field trip! Culinary mentions... let's eat it! "Bossbabe" inspiration... let's network and collectively build and develop our brands! Soup for the soul reads... let's apply the book's premise to initiatives in our own communities! Our books may take us to restaurants, museums, movies, events, and good ol' fashioned couches with wine, dessert, and light-to-serious book discussions.

~Members 40+ years young: You can totally sit with us! It's a reality that our interests in people and activities change with time, so we'd like to you know up-front that this group is Millennial-ish. 

Like us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/Readers-Shakers-17...

Follow us on Instagram @readersandshakers

Blog http://1stnoelle.com/
results.name: Readers & Shakers NY

results.description:
We meet each Tuesday evening (7:30pm) at the Mahwah Public Library (100 Ridge Rd, Mahwah, NJ 07430) to meditate and experience the innate connection we have with each other and the energy that created us.

What can you expect? Relax. It's Easy. Whether you are looking for a practical method to handle stress, a life too full of priorities, or for insights into the meaning of life, into spiritual growth, this will help. 

Sahaja Yoga Meditation is unique in ways too numerous to explain here. Unlike other forms of meditation or yoga, this is not something you "do" - it is more about a state of becoming, of "being" rather than doing, a living process that transforms your life from within.

Classes are:

led by experts, with thousands of hours of practical experience, deep knowledge and skill. In addition, there are often people training to become instructors who are happy to offer individual guidance. 

tailored to the needs of the attendees. A starter session will be given if there are newcomers. New techniques and insights are always available for regulars. Advanced techniques will also be explored.

no more than an hour. Not long, considering the benefits can last a lifetime. They begin with a brief introduction followed by 40-50 minutes of instruction, and meditation practice.

What Sahaja Meditation Can Do For You

Sahaja Meditation is good for heart, mind, body and soul. It's all about energy — Kundalini Energy — and everyone has it. Sahaja Meditation is a simple technique that lets you tap into that energy and harness its power to become better balanced and better connected to yourself — emotionally, physically, and spiritually. It's easy. Anyone can do it.  

Here are just a few specific benefits Sahaja Meditation offers…  
• Immediate stress relief and long-term stress management  
• Improve physical and emotional health and boost long-term resilience  
• Improve overall personality and relationships  
• Balance personal and professional responsibilities  
• Take control of your life; control negative emotions such as anger, fear, anxiety, guilt  
• Improve cognitive functioning: focus, clarity, decision-making and problem-solving skills, enhanced creativity  

What is Sahaja Meditation?  

How does Sahaja Meditation differ from other popular forms of meditation? On the surface, Sahaja Meditation has a lot in common with other forms of meditation. But what's unique to Sahaja is the ability to awaken and connect to your Kundalini Energy and influence the movement of this energy up through your body's seven primary energy centers known as chakras, to achieve physical and emotional well-being and ultimately establish a spiritual connection.  

How does energy flow work? It flows through each of your energy centers or chakras, energizing, nurturing and balancing them. Think of your Inner Energy system as a flute with seven holes — each hole representing a chakra, and your inner energy representing the air that is blown through the flute. If the flute's holes are unobstructed, the flute can produce melodious, harmonious music in the hands of a skilled musician. And so it is with your chakras. When they're clear and free of obstructions, your inner energy flows through your body smoothly, achieving a harmonious balance.  

Once awakened, you'll find that Sahaja Meditation makes it easy to meditation effortlessly. Most forms of meditation don't allow you to easily actualize the energy on Day 1. The reason is that Sahaja Meditation has the unique ability to achieve the powerful state of thoughtless awareness, quickly and effortlessly. What is thoughtless awareness? Think of it as purified attention, a state of maximum energy flow during which your mind is calmed and gradually emptied of all distractions and negative thoughts and feelings. Sahaja Meditation techniques allow you to extend that fraction-of-a-second gap between one thought and the next to remain in a thoughtless state for as long as you wish. Thoughtless awareness is a much-needed break from the thoughts that constantly bombard us all day long.  

Overview.

The primary focus of Sahaja Meditation classes, especially for beginners, is awakening and experiencing the energy with the goal of achieving thoughtless awareness. We'll provide a brief overview of the subtle energy system so that you can understand the sensations you feel within your body and correlate your experience to real physical and mental attributes. But experience is always valued over knowledge. In other words, the proof of the pudding is in the eating, not in learning how to make elaborate pudding recipes or discussing how wonderful the pudding tastes.  

If you continue to practice Sahaja Meditation, you'll discover and experience, step by step, your own energy centers and their associated qualities. Once you're able to consistently feel the energy and have experienced noticeable differences in your cognitive and emotional states, you can explore more advanced techniques, such as clearing and healing the chakras. You'll learn how the energy centers play a vital role in our evolutionary process of becoming better human beings and experience holistic improvement on all planes — physical, cognitive, emotional and spiritual. In the ultimate and most advanced phases, you may choose to use Sahaja Meditation to discover your inner spiritual self and how you can evolve to higher realms of spirituality. For many, Sahaja is much more than just a temporary solution or quick relief. It is a journey, rather than a destination.  

Ultimately, Sahaja classes can provide a complete course on meditation and spirituality, which you can continue to experiment with and verify at every step. Just as no two life experiences are exactly alike, no two Sahaja Meditation experiences are exactly alike. You can explore at your own pace, in your own way. There are no rules, restrictions or rituals. Sahaja is entirely Do-It-Yourself. And we are always available to help.  

There's no pressure to continue attending classes. You can come once or twice and never come back again or you can attend classes weekly. Many find that attending classes weekly is just what they need to recharge their batteries.  

The power of collective meditation. 

Collective meditation in an optimized environment can be exhilarating and rejuvenating. In fact, generally, the larger the group, the better the experience. Collective meditation is also likely to help you progress faster in the initial weeks, as compared to meditating at home, alone.
results.name: Weekly, Free Meditation at the Mahwah Public Libra

results.description: Straight, gay, any race or ethnicity, coupled, divorced, young, old: we all share the experience of navigating our worlds as men, and tonight we’ll accept the invitation to share our experience with each other. As men, we experience for most waking moments of our lives the burdens and the rewards of responsibility. From the time we’re just out of diapers we’re charged by our parents, our peers, our lovers, ourselves, with the task of maintaining certainty, and if we don’t feel certainty, of manufacturing it. Tonight’s going to be different—tonight we’ll ask all who come to drop the certainty and gather around a comfortable white sofa with a glass of wine and a sense of curiosity. What brings you joy? What keeps you up at night? How’s your heart? What do you love, and what would you like to be different? What do you want to share, or hear from your brothers? We’ve all traveled far to get here and we all have far to go. Let’s travel together.
results.name: Himself: conversations between men

results.description:
HELLO THERE, AND WELCOME TO BRONX SOFTBALL!

If you're looking to play softball, you've come to the right place!

We are a group of adults who play casual pickup games in the Bronx and lower Westchester. We schedule events on weeknigts, mainly Wednesdays, between May and September.

It is our mission to provide a weekly softball night and a fun time for enthusiastic players. This is not a league. We only play in the interest of fun. This group is perfect for people who want to play without committing to an entire season or if you just want to add a game to your schedule.

Groups will typically meet at Pelham Bay Park in the Bronx, and anyone is welcome. We do not possess permits any so we have to play on any field that happens to be open. We would love to get input from our members on available fields where you might be interested in playing.

If you are new to Meetup.com let me tell you that being a member is very convenient, and best of all, is free! Once you sign up and join the group you get notified each time a new event is scheduled. Then you just RSVP "YES" or "NO" each time. It's that simple! And it's even easier with the app.

The games themselves:

-Regular Lob Pitch with Clincher softballs

-Batters start with a 1-1 count (umpired by a volunteer or an honorable teammate)

-Any swing counts as a strike

-Running the bases only after contact

-Tagging from any base

-Infield fly rule when applicable

-If a guy walks on three pitches and a girl is on deck, the girl walks too

-No runner can be thrown out (on a force) from the outfield on a ball hit by a girl

-Designated runners in lieu of intentional walks (this means that if the defense wishes to intentionally walk a batter, that batter may appoint a random player to stand on the open base rather being walked and losing his or her at-bat)

Players are chosen for teams based on position.
results.name: Co-Ed Bronx & Westchester Adult Pickup Softball

results.description:
Did we have you at "laughter yoga?" Laughter Yoga was developed by Dr. Kataria, a doctor who recognized the therapeutic nature of laughter. Laughter allows our inner child to come out, to connect with others effortlessly while dropping our judgements and being in the moment. When we laugh, we release endorphins and reduce stress.  

Let's incorporate more laughter into our lives! When we do so, we naturally lower our defensive, fearful, anxious and ego-related energy and allow more gratitude, joy, peace, love, positivity and fun to everything we do. It's about letting go and feeling lighter. When you choose to align your energy toward the positive, your life experiences will be rigged in that direction.  This positive state facilitates better relationships with ourselves and others, allowing us to magnetize our goals and cultivate greater satisfaction in our lives.

 Feel free to send us a message if you have any questions!

With Joy, 

Michelle and Yasmin

To learn more about us and what we do, explore our websites:

http://michellesoufian.wix.com/welcome

https://andiamore.wordpress.com/
results.name: Laughter Yoga- It's a good time to have a good time!

results.description:
Digital Art Collection Club helps the art lovers to gain insight knowledge about the art objects created with digital technology. For the art collectors who are shifting their mindset from the Physical to the Digital, our club is the right place to discover your next collection to invest for your homes and offices.  <br>

We share with our club members the way to appreciate digitally created art objects, their genres, market value, and possibilities to cohabit with us in our living and working spaces. We want our members to be the "Futurists" of their lives. 

The great artworks that we introduce to our Futurists are made by the most talented artists in North America, Europe, and Asia, all accessible for private or corporate collections. We invite regularly artists, designers, architects, digital art consultants, private or corporate collectors, professionals from real-estate and hotel industries to join our events, exchange their experience working with and collecting digital artworks. From time to time, we also invite our members to go on artists and designers' studio visits, evening live performances or digital art related events. 

Digital Art Collection Club is a networking platform where art, technology and business people can meet and explore the extraordinary value of digital art. We'd love our members to step out from their own professions, make new friends or business partners, start innovative collaborations, or just become the next Futurist collector of digital art. <br>

<br>

DACC events usually contain two major programs: DACC INTERVIEW is a half-hour interview moderated by DACC founder, Juliette Yuan, with one specific invited speaker at every session. DACC YOUR ATTENTION MOMENT highlights a professional's work in art and technology, an ongoing or upcoming event, a book release, or any other news that happens at the moment we host our event. 

When you join our Club, please upload your photo so we can recognize you when you come to our events, please fill out the members' questions so we know how to work better and smarter to reach your expectations.
results.name: Digital Art Collection Club

results.description:
Calling all Healthcare Millennials! This is a group for young professionals (typically ages 21-40) who are employed or interested in entering the healthcare industry. 

The Young Professionals Healthcare Network (YPHN) was established in 2014.  The Young Professionals Healthcare Network is a global non-profit dedicated to "Empowering the Next Generation of Healthcare Leaders". Our mission is to build a strong network for young healthcare professionals by providing healthcare driven programming, leadership initiatives, career development services, and networking events as a platform to address the universal challenges of eradicating healthcare disparities globally. As of today, the Young Professionals Healthcare Network has successfully hosted a series of programs and events that cater 150+ young healthcare professionals across the tri-state area.

By joining the Young Professionals Healthcare Network, you will enjoy the following benefits:

• Exclusive web content and invitations to events at the United Nations (UN), World Health Organization (WHO), Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), US Department of State and US Department for Human & Health ServicesNetworking

• Free or discounted admissions to network and partner events

• Invitations to exclusive members-only programs

• Opportunities to search and post job vacancies on the YPHN Job Board powered by SimplyHired

We invite you to learn more about Young Professionals Healthcare Network (YPHN), by joining us our next General Meeting. Guests are always welcome and RSVPing is highly encouraged. Guest fees may apply.
results.name: Young Professionals Healthcare Network Meetup

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in living deeper, more meaningful lives. We'll explore spirituality, intentional living, psychic development, personal growth and more. All levels are welcome. I started this group to share my passion with others and to create community. I look forward to meeting you and growing our tribe together.
results.name: Deeper Insight Montclair

results.description:
Who we are? 

The West NY | Hoboken | Social Group 20s & 30s is a fun and active social group that creates opportunities through social events to make friends and build a social network. Each social event offers opportunity for good laughs, meaningful connections, great fun, and overall memorable times. The group provides the ideal solution to fulfill your social life needs. We are a very diverse group of people with various backgrounds and nationalities. 

Where are we? 

While this group originated in West New York, NJ we host events throughout the Tri-state area and New York City. Feel free to peruse our past Meetups for the different venues. Whatever your choice of venue may be, the West NY | Hoboken | Social Group 20s & 30s can make it happen! 

What do we do? 

We regularly organize exciting and fun events! We offer a wide variety of event themes. The events can range in size from large gatherings at nightclubs or popular attraction sites to smaller and more intimate places where it is easier interact and socialize on a personal level. 

Our mission: 

We work hard to create a welcoming and friendly atmosphere where members feel comfortable to connect and relate with one another. We thrive on the principle that new members are treated as equally as old members. We take pride in promoting a environment of inclusivity, and not exclusivity. 

We value our members 

We encourage members to provide feedback on the general experience with the group. Member's input is extremely important to our success as a social Meetup group. Your ideas and insights help the group create more interesting and exciting events. 

** We kindly request that you provide a valid profile picture that clearly shows your face and answer the introductory questions as this will help us know a little bit about you. We appreciate your cooperation in this matter :) ** 

Come join us and let the fun begin!!!!
results.name: West NY | Hoboken | Social Group 20s & 30s

Host and teach series of classes serving exotic tea or salacious wine, depending on the time of day. Become a member. With membership includes supplies and hors d'oeuvres. Just bring your smiles and sense of humor. Sign up early! Space is limited.

results.description:
What if your life were more joyful… wonderful… meaningful... and successful? It can be.

At the same time you can help our world be more beautiful and sustainable? You can.

How?
I'll let you in on a "new" secret. It "hides" in plain sight:

When we find it enjoyable to change our lives and world, it happens more quickly and fully.

In this new (! :-) Meetup we'll share ideas… enjoy inspiring and fun cultural activities… build friendships… and help create a diverse range of awesome…

Were exploring how we can do this in our personal lives, our relationships, our communities, for nature, our spiritual lives and more!

Of course, change isn't always simple. We're finding and using ways to make it easier – and better!

You
If you're already involved in change, great! If you're not – or if you sometimes find it difficult, frustrating or boring – this group is also for you!

Me
I've been involved in change all my adult life. I've done some valuable things and I'd like to do even more. With you.

I look forward to meeting you!

-Bill
results.name: The Joy of Change

results.description: We are a motorcycle club that stays in touch with Jewish culture and religion. We do many benefit rides, Jewish and Non-Jewish related to raise money. We have also gone for many years to Jewish camps to give rides and show our bikes to children with special needs. We meet to ride, have great company and great foods in the most scenic, beautiful areas of NY, NJ, CT, PA and beyond.

results.description: With ARK, I'm hoping to meet like-minded people who are interested in using art to relax and spread kindness. This exploration of mediums of creative expression in art & crafts will allow members to unleash their inner creativity. For example, we would have activities such as painting, and coloring to name a few. results.description:
This group was created for those who wanted something different from their normal group of friends. At some point we've all said to ourselves "I need something new," whether that meant new friends, different foods, change of scenery, or something to boost your adrenaline. So let's get together for affordable activities throughout NJ and surrounding areas! This group will host several events monthly such as: brunches, social gatherings, wine tastings, comedy shows, outdoor activities, and more. There isn't anything we won't try. So bring your personalities, positive energy, and suggestions. This group is open to both men and women of all backgrounds.

To join this group we ask that you:

- are 25 and older

- an active member

- have a picture of yourself on your profile (I love pets and sunsets too but it won't help us all find each other at an event!)

- use your actual name or nickname (no screen names please)


"Become friends with people who aren't your age. Hang out with people who first language is not your own. Get to know someone who doesn't come your social class. This is how you see the world. This is how you grow."

NO SHOW POLICY: 1. If you RSVP "yes" to an event and do not attend, you are a "no show" 2. If you are a "no show" to three events, you will be removed from the group. We understand emergencies do happen, but events take time and a lot of effort to plan so please be mindful and update your RSVP's.
results.name: Oh! By the Way... (Lets Hang Out, 25-40)

results.description: It was the first week of the year on a cold Brooklyn Saturday afternoon. I was sharing a few pints of craft beer at The Double Windsor in Windsor Terrace with 2 awesome women I know. It was a great way to start a year, and I had a thought: why not do this more often with other badass ladies who love craft beer as much as I do? Hence, Crafty Broads was born. This group's mission is to travel to the best craft beer bars in NYC and share pints with fellow craft beer aficionadas. Do you love craft beer? Do you love meeting other awesome women like your craft-beer-loving self? If so, this group is for you! Women of all ages (21+) and feminists are welcome!
results.name: Crafty Broads: Women Who Love Craft Beer!

results.description:
Been looking for work for months? Wondering if there are actually any job openings in the United States? Need help getting out of bed to do the usual of hitting up Starbucks armed with your laptop only to leave after looking for 10 minutes? Need social support to keep you plugging away? If you can relate this group is for you. I'd like to meet at least a couple of times a week during the day and have a "study group" of Internet job searches. Basically, since we are in a group it'll guarantee us that'll we'll all search longer and with more effort. If you need some support, join, I do.


Enjoy good coffee too
results.name: Astoria Job Search Group @ Coffee Shops Daily

results.description:
This is a non-denominational Adult Single God fearing Christians. Members are ages 35 to 75 Singles and Single-Agains for whatever reasons. We believe in the power of prayer. We practice an 'out of the box' approach to issues of delayed marriages, difficult relationships, broken dreams, loneliness, disappointments and other issues faced by the Christian Singles and Single Agains. 

We are educated, single and professionals in various fields. We love to get together for affordable activities in our neighborhood, having breakfast meetings at weekends and public holidays, having picnics, organizing praise dances, going to movies and sharing the word of God. We are a bunch of fun loving people who enjoy an enabling environment to meet or get introduced to Christians of like minds. 

 We  attend events in each other's churches and social occasions. 

We believe that our God is a God of New Beginning and of Second Chance. Thus we know that as you trust Him, you would find that "special person" along the way.  

We are here to support one another because if we don't who else is there to support us but God. 99% of churches have nothing on their menu for our category. When they discuss marriage issues, the adult single Agains are written off, spoken of in a derogatory, no-go- area undertones. But guess what, we will rather believe in the Lord  who says that He will do a new thing...Joel 2: 25. He said that his thought towards us is to give us hope and a future. Jeremiah 29:11.

Romans 8:31 says "What, then, shall we say in response to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?"

Come on, come out, lets enjoy abundant life in our Lord Jesus Christ. John 10:10.

Welcome!
results.name: NY PRACTICING CHRISTIAN- SINGLES & SINGLE AGAINS 35-75 YRS

topics.name: How to Declutter Your Home and Life

results.description:
"Minimalism is not the lack of something, it is the perfect amount of something" Calling all minimalists and simplicity enthusiasts in New York. Let's help each other to make space and time to create the life we want to live by decluttering, curating, and editing your life to a life that you would be proud of. (Plus , a life that is more sustainable & environmentally friendly via minimalism) This group is for support, inspiration, and motivation!

Here people who deal with issues such as minimalist lifestyle, sustainability and reduced consumption meet. The 5 Rs: Refuse, Reduce, Reuse, Repair, Recycle are an important part of the way of thinking in everyday life.

This meetup group in New York City will host meetings in all 5 boroughs for everyone who wants to discover, learn more or share their experiences with minimalism. Minimalism is a lifestyle that helps people question what adds value to their lives. By clearing the clutter from life's path, we can all make room for the most important aspects of life: health, relationships, passion, growth, and contribution. There are many flavors of minimalism: a twenty-year-old single guy's minimalist lifestyle looks different from a forty-five-year-old mother's minimalist life. Even though everyone embraces minimalism differently, each path leads to the same place: a more purposeful and deliberate life.

If this speaks to you, join in the upcoming conversations! You can attend by yourself or bring a friend/partner!

An introduction to minimalism starts here:
http://www.theminimalists.com/
http://theminimalists.com/podcast
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iKhQ75DfD2k

https://www.facebook.com/NewYorkCityMinimalismGroup/

https://www.facebook.com/groups/464826070394574/


In this group, it is not about to reach a consensus or to solve the problems of the world. Rather, an exchange of interested and committed people with different motivations and lifestyles.
results.name: New York City Minimalism Group

results.description: This book club is not going to involve books with a damsel in distress. Screw that. It is not going to involve the female characters waiting for the right guy to "change." It is going to be about us. Powerful characters who inspire us to be more than just romantic interests/sexual objects/background characters in our own lives. We want equality in our books! Everyone is invited to join.
results.name: Feminist Book Club

results.description:
Everything you've always wanted to know about how to transition out of a lease (even before the term is up) and get on a lease with upsetting your bank account.

Whether you're about to sign a new lease or tired of the one you're on, you can come by one of our meetups to:

- Get a free consultation with one of our leasing experts: Learn about the terms in your lease that are rendered null and void by state law, terms you should never agree to and things you can do to polish your profile as a renter.

-Mingle with people working on all different aspects of housing, real estate, financial empowerment and technology

-Enjoy cocktails and snacks provided by our partners

Together let's bring affordability to renting.
results.name: Peer to Peer Leasing

results.description: This group is for moms who don’t give up the idea of staying in shape even with the lack of sleep and other not so beautiful side effects of motherhood. Thanks to the variety of jogging strollers on the market, now we can cross over unwanted weight off the list. Also, fresh air will soothe babies to sleep while their mothers can enjoy the weather, exercise and other moms’ company. I have a 6 month-old and would like to continue my jogging in the park with my baby boy. looking forward to meeting other moms who want to exercise, have some walk in the park(the Reservoir area) or just have a coffee in a nearby café. I also look for playdates for my son.
results.name: Upper East Side Jogging Group For Moms with Strollers

results.description: We focus on traveling to a variety of escape games around the city, trying our best to escape the room within one hour. Everyone is invited, nobody is unwelcome.

results.description:
Welcome! I am a Stay-at-home mom looking for a fun and active group of mothers with busy babies and toddlers to meetup around Short Hills and the surrounding area. Our meetups will allow the children (under age 4) to socialize and play, while the moms exchange advice, support and laugh together.
Meetups will be held at many venues around the area, such as local parks; Public Libraries; Restaurants; the Zoo; and at member's homes, to name a few. Most events will occur during working hours but occasionally we will have weekend family events. We will also have monthly Moms Night Out activities!
results.name: MOSH-Moms Of Short Hills, NJ

results.description: "This group has been formed for those librarians interested in developing, expanding or incorporating STEAM programs. What does STEAM programming mean to public libraries and early literacy services? As a group we can spend this time exploring what has been implemented in Public Libraries and also brainstorm new ideas. I am starting this group because I feel that there are so many talented librarian that can make learning fun, creative and innovative not only for the children but for their own career development. Let's explore together."
results.name: STEAM in Libraries

results.description: It's getting serious out there, and nerves need shaking into flow with verbal humor for every tickling appropriate moment that can be found. It's essential for me to practice finding joy from using  humor willingly: not stifling it from shyness, guilt, shame or it being flat to others' ears. Are you up to accept others responses whether it's a head shake from side to side or hearing, " are you kidding?" or a laugh aloud, or I don't get it? I'm creating this meetup to invite likemindeds into a friendly arena. Would you like to sit with seekers of getting comfortable with trying out sorts of their own verbal humor in all moments possible among like minded crazies? If you can answer yes, well that makes you an integral member of this meetup. Join me in creating a humor honing zone, for many self evolving evenings, and with any spur of the moment topic as fodder. We're being brave and honing our humor zone. One gem may nail it, the next falls flat. This is the arena for getting comfortable with exploring your own personal brand of humor in all moments among like minded crazies. This makes this meetup evening our thing. No masters, or lessons, or humor guidelines, no physical humor, no abusive humor. Our goal isn't to to be comedians, or standsups. Let's meet and chat about everything and find our humor rather than criticism, frowns, sad sighs, pursed lips, defensive or offensive tackles, fears and anger and controlling egos.
results.name: Honing Honest Humor

results.description:
In your hand right now you have the ultimate tool to create compelling, relevant, high quality video...its your smartphone. It shoots HD video, can go places regular expensive cameras can't, allows you to edit in real time and enables you to publish to your social media channels. Its an all in one all singing all dancing mobile production studio…and you are the Director! 

This group is for anyone interested in discussing and learning more about producing broadcast quality video using a smartphone and the opportunities it has opened up in Public Relations, Social Media, Activism, Creative Agencies and Corporate communications. I started this group because I'm eager to share my experiences of producing smartphone film all over the world and help others to do this same. Don’t be shy now…come along… ...when you take a step in to the unknown good things happen :).

This is...The Art of Smartphone Filmmaking!

https://youtu.be/9nsKl1VYNXQ
results.name: The Art of Smartphone Filmmaking - New York Meetup

results.description:
Join us for a multidisciplinary networking, learning and collaboration. Taking inspiration from The Medici Effect*, The Renaissance, and even such creative collaborations as Burning Man...How can the intersection of science and technology with arts, culture, philosophy, consciousness...etcetera...amplify innovation and create new ways of thinking, behaving, expressing and living?

We will also explore questions around the evolving edge of science and technology and their contribution to improving our collective knowledge and experience. How can they best serve us and the planet? 

All welcome.

This meetup group is one of the local communities of The Ollin Institute (pronounced "All-in"). Given the intention of the group, we will be doing multi-meetup events with our other groups such as Express Yourself (Arts) which we have also just launched in New York City.

*Frans Johansson’s The Medici Effect shows how breakthrough ideas most often occur when we bring concepts from one field into a new, unfamiliar territory, and offers examples how we can turn the ideas we discover into path-breaking innovations.

"When you bring together diverse teams and perspectives, you have the ability to create an exponential increase in ideas....Diverse teams create far more ideas than homogenous teams" -Frans Johansson
results.name: Collide: Tech, Sci, Arts, Culture and...-NYC

results.description:
Are you creative, love sharing ideas and play well with others? This is the group for you! Join other passionate individuals to explore the world of ideas, self-expression, creativity and experimentation.

Perfect for professional and amateur creatives of all types (photographers, performers, graphic artists, writers, singers/songwriters, comedians, musicians, film makers, dancers....you get the idea!) as well as educators/experts/authors, thought leaders, and those of us that are just happy to ham it up. Like participating by being an appreciative audience member or learning new things? Great, you can join too!

In addition to networking and fun events where we can share our talents, we will also be offering opportunities for discussion and learning around the creative process, self expression and communication including cultivating creativity and using improv and play for problem solving, culture building, and personal growth work.

Our events will range in cost depending on format.

This meetup group is one of the local communities of The Ollin Institute (pronounced "All-in").  We are looking for people interested in partnering with us through hosting, presenting or organizing this group. Send Trish a note if you are interested.

We will be also doing multi-meetup events with our other meetup groups. Here is a full listing.

topics.name: How to Declutter Your Home and Life

results.description:
Clutter saps your energy and keeps you from getting what you want. Are you ready to get rid of the clutter in your home or workplace, but you don’t know where to start? Or maybe you’ve made progress, but your decluttering project is stalled?

Come join us!

The New York Declutter Coaching Meetup is a community of people who want to conquer their clutter and make more room for the things they love. Come learn tools and tips from an expert, and share your success stories and “ah-hah!” moments. Or just listen to the group discussion and enjoy the support and camaraderie of your fellow declutterers. Professional organizer/Minimilist Mark Anthony, organizer of New York City Minimalism Meetup, will address a variety of organizing-related topics, answer your questions, and moderate the group discussion.
results.name: New York City Declutter Coaching Meetup

results.description: What do 24 million people around the world have in common? They've all tried Alpha! Alpha is a series of gatherings where we talk about life and the Christian faith. Each session features a delicious (free) meal, a thought-provoking video and a small group discussion where everyone’s doubts and questions are welcome. Alpha is for anyone who’s curious--those who don’t go to church and those who do. Our weekly sessions start Thursday, February 11 from 7-9pm in the lower level of Ss Peter & Paul Church on the corner of 4th and Hudson. There's no pressure, no follow up if it's not for you, and no charge. See more at alphausa.org, and please RSVP by signing up at spphoboken.com/alpha (so we know how much food to order, not to spam you!). #TryAlpha
results.name: Alpha

results.description: Reconnect is a gathering of women who are seeking spiritual growth and deeper understanding of Jewish spirituality. We meet on a regular schedule (once a month) to learn from ancient and new interpretations of Torah, Tanakh, Kaballah, and other related topics. Our goal is to grow a community of women committed to personal growth.
results.name: Reconnect: A Jewish Woman's Path to Spirituality

results.description:
Looking for a group to run during all the seasons of life and weather? Looking to stay in shape, get in shape, or train for a marathon then please join us. Join us for group runs or find a running buddy. Whatever fits your lifestyle needs and time. There will also be times we have group social or events. If you are an experienced runner and would like to lead some runs please contact the organizer. Please be advised, if you have any medical issues that would prevent you from strenuous activity, or joint, tendon and bone disorders, do not join. If you have heart and lung issues, definitely do not join and seek medical advice. By signing up for membership you agree to accept [all] the physical and health risks that comes with exertion, aerobic exercise and running, such injury, and including death. Happy running :)

 Thanks!
results.name: NY/NJ Asian Runners

topics.name: Internet Marketing Strategies For Business Owners

results.description:
This is a group for any Blab.im, Periscope, MeVee, Facebook Live, Go Live With, Google Hangouts Live, MeerKat or other people interested in learning and doing livestream video broadcasts and public speaking.  YouTube broadcasters also welcome!

As an active Blab broadcaster, I recognize the importance of also meeting people in person.  I started this group to inspire other live streamers around the world to meet in person, accelerate business relationships, share best practices with each other, and grow the global community of live streamers.  

It is also important for us to meet in person to build closer business relationships, make connections, and help the global community develop and adopt best practices to limit or help eliminate negative experiences in the global live streaming video world, such as spam, trolls, fraud and other socially unacceptable and/or criminal behavior.

One of the best ways to differentiate yourself in business is through public speaking and broadcasting including Blab.im, Periscope, Facebook Livestream, MeVee, Meerkat, GoLiveWith and Snapchat, as well as new and emerging platforms.  

All levels of public speaking and live streaming video are welcome! You can expect to network with other businesses, speakers and social media enthusiasts while learning new tricks and tips of the trade. No matter what your skill, this group is meant to help you grow your skills and business using live streaming video.

This is already a game changer in social media and online business, so be sure to get involved while it is still early in the game.  It is easier than ever to connect with people through video broadcasting.  

You can bring your message to the world, and help others in the process.  Come meet like minded people and be part of a movement that is changing the world for the better!
results.name: NYC - Blab, Periscope and Live Video Streaming Users Meetup

results.description:
This open mic, exclusively features original electronic music in a cool cafe setting. Other artists have opportunities to perform their music and poetry. Now electronic musicians have their space to play! This is a venue for people who are at the beginning stages of gigging, a place for a seasoned producers to tryout a side-project, a home for beatheads who need new music constantly, a gallery for visual artists who love electronic, and a forum for creating electronic music and making connections. Come be a part of this underground electronic event. Pre-register for a 15 minute slot. Walk-ins welcome. We encourage all genres and BPMs. 


FREE. Beer, coffee, wine, food for sale. All ages. 21+ to drink.

Our wonderful host, who has seen us from 0 likes to over 120, has been Muchmore's.

Muchmore's. 2 Havemeyer St. Brooklyn. 5 minute walk from Lorimer (L), Metropolitan (G) stations.

pre reigister: knieratka@gmail.com
results.name: Electronic Open Mic

results.description:
Practical Unity development skills for both Beginner and Experienced developers.
Our mentor group is made of experienced Unity developers each with a variety of specializations and market niches.
The core curriculum is a free class that will teach you how to develop Virtual Reality / Augmented Reality applications using Unity.

Other disciplines we teach to help you become a Pro at Unity are:
C# Scripting
3D Modeling
3D Texturing
3D Lighting
3D Rigging/Animation
3D Sound Design (Talking Sequences, Event Action Sequences)
2D Graphics
Platform Specific Tuning (Oculus Rift, Samsung Gear VR , Google Cardboard, HTC Vive)

If you are an experienced Unity developer and would like to share your knowledge with the community we welcome you and encourage you to do so! You can contact any of the organizers through meetup, or come talk to us at any of our events.

Visit UnityEducation.com to see our "Learn VR development in 1 hour" video to get a basic introduction to VR && AR development with Unity

2016 is the year where VR && AR will become established in the industry, come join us and learn real world skills in the next biggest tech revolution since the smartphone.
results.name: Unity Education NYC - VR && AR
